content: The US government is not yet willing to draw a direct line between Iran and the shocking sneak attacks by Hamas militants on Israel outside the Gaza Strip, but President Joe Biden’s domestic political rivals are convinced.

title: 11 US citizens dead in Israel conflict, Biden says

content: Eleven US citizens have died in the conflict in Israel, President Joe Biden said Monday, and an unknown number remain missing.

title: Israeli defense minister orders ‘complete siege’ of Gaza, as Hamas threatens hostages

content: Israel’s Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu said Monday that the Israeli military would attack Hamas with a force “like never before,” as the militant group threatened to kill civilian hostages if airstrikes target Gaza without warning.

title: American cities bolster security around places of worship after the catastrophic attacks in Israel

title: ‘Grief and anger.’ US business groups stand up for Israel after attack
author: cnn
content: Business leaders across the United States have expressed outrage and solidarity with Israel after the deadly surprise attack by Hamas.

title: Dow climbs nearly 200 points as investors brush off worries about rising oil prices

title: Democratic divisions over Israel policy heat up as Biden tries to keep his coalition together

content: The deadly surprise offensive by Hamas militants on Israel over the weekend threatens to ignite tensions between moderate and progressive Democrats already divided over the Jewish state’s treatment of Palestinians in Gaza and the occupied West Bank.

title: Opinion: In times of crisis, Israelis rally around their leaders. This time is different

title: Oil price spikes on Israel war. Here’s what a wider conflict might mean

content: Global oil prices climbed 4% Monday over fears that the unprecedented weekend attack on Israel by Hamas could escalate into a regional conflict embroiling oil-producing nations.

title: U2 pays tribute to those killed in Israel music festival attack

title: US still seeking to determine Iran’s connection to Israel attack

content: The Biden administration has yet to find a smoking gun linking Iran directly to planning and executing the attack on Israel this weekend, US officials told CNN on Sunday.

title: At least 4 Americans killed in Israel attacks with death toll expected to rise, Schumer says
author: cnn
content: At least four Americans have been killed in the attacks in Israel, and US officials expect the death toll to rise, Sen. Chuck Schumer said Sunday.

title: October 8, 2023 Israel-Hamas war news

content: Fighting in Israel is raging a day after Hamas fighters breached the border from Gaza in a surprise attack, killing hundreds of people. Follow for live updates.

title: Videos show new details on how Hamas launched surprise assault on Israel

title: UEFA postpones soccer matches in Israel due to ongoing conflict

title: Hamas has launched an unprecedented attack against Israel. Here’s what to know

content: The large-scale surprise attack by Gaza militants on Israel on Saturday has left hundreds of Israelis dead, prompting a lethal volley of retaliatory Israeli airstrikes and a formal declaration of war on Sunday.

title: France, UK and Germany step up security measures amid fears of attacks against Jewish community
author: cnn
content: The UK, France, and Germany have all pledged to step up security measures amid fears of attacks against members of the Jewish community after videos emerged of people apparently celebrating deadly attacks launched by Hamas militants.

title: A ‘Pearl Harbor’ moment: Why didn’t Israel’s sophisticated border security stop Saturday’s attack?
author: cnn
content: The gunmen came from air, sea and land. They shot at civilians, took hostages and forced families to barricade themselves indoors, fearing for their lives.

title: Hamas captures hostages as Israelis share photos of those missing
author: cnn
content: Hamas captured a number of Israelis during its deadly attack on Israel on Saturday, the Israeli military said, as videos emerged of Israeli soldiers and civilians being taken away by fighters from the Palestinian militant group.

title: Airlines cancel flights to Israel amid attacks
author: cnn
content: Airlines scrambled to cancel flights into Israel early Saturday after Palestinian militants launched a surprise attack, firing thousands of rockets from Gaza into nearby Israeli towns during a Jewish holiday.

title: Opinion: Hamas’ attack on Israel is an indisputable act of terrorism
author: cnn
content: The Israeli-Palestinian conflict is extraordinarily complicated. But there’s no denying that what happened on Saturday was an act of terrorism, one that deserves clear, unequivocal condemnation, writes Frida Ghitis.

title: Why this Israel-Gaza conflict is so complicated for Biden
author: cnn
content: President Joe Biden and his top aides are contending with an exceedingly complicated diplomatic situation unlike any previous conflict between the Israelis and the Palestinians.

title: Opinion: Did Hamas attacks have a hidden target?
author: cnn
content: The surprise weekend attack by Hamas, involving thousands of missiles fired from Gaza and on-the-ground fighting inside Israel, has the potential to upend an emerging diplomatic deal that could reshape the region, writes Peter Bergen.

title: Netanyahu says Israel is ‘at war’ after Hamas launches surprise air and ground attack from Gaza
author: cnn
content: Israel’s Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu declared that the country was “at war” on Saturday, after Palestinian militants in Gaza fired a deadly barrage of rockets and sent gunmen into Israeli territory in a major escalation of the long running conflict between the two sides.

title: US officials raise concerns over Israeli intelligence after Hamas attacks
author: cnn
content: American officials said Saturday they received no warning through intelligence that Hamas was preparing to attack Israel, leading to confusion among some at how Israel failed to detect signs of the rocket assault.

title: Bruno Mars Tel Aviv concert canceled
author: cnn
content: Bruno Mars’ show scheduled to take place in Tel Aviv, Israel on Saturday night has been canceled, according to concert organizer Live Nation Israel.

title: Drone attack on Syria military college kills at least 89 and wounds hundreds more
author: cnn
content: Death tolls rose to at least 89 people after drones laden with explosives hit a military college graduation ceremony in the western Syrian city of Homs on Wednesday, wounding hundreds more.

title: American man arrested in Israel for smashing Roman statues in museum
author: cnn
content: An American man has been arrested in Israel on suspicion of “the deliberate defacement” of valuable sculptures at the Israel Museum in Jerusalem, Israeli police have confirmed.

title: Israeli police arrest five following uproar over Jews spitting on Christians
author: cnn
content: Israel Police arrested five people Wednesday on suspicion of spitting towards Christians or churches in the Old City of Jerusalem, they announced, following an uproar a day earlier over Orthodox Jews spitting at Christian pilgrims.

title: As Azerbaijan claims final victory in Nagorno Karabakh, arms trade with Israel comes under scrutiny
author: cnn
content: On September 19, the day Azerbaijan began its offensive in the majority Armenian region of Nagorno-Karabakh, Marut Vanyan heard an ominous noise in the sky over his hometown.

title: Syria’s drug problem casts shadow over Assad’s rehabilitation
author: cnn
content: Almost five months since Arab states extended an olive branch to Syrian President Bashar al-Assad, there are signs that some key architects of the initiative may be growing skeptical about his commitment to the agreement.

title: Biden administration announces visa-free travel for Israelis
author: cnn
content: Israel will be joining the US Visa Waiver Program, allowing Israeli citizens to soon enter the United States without a visa and vice versa, the Biden administration has announced.

title: Two Palestinian men killed during Israeli incursion in camp near Tulkarem
author: cnn
content: Two Palestinian men were killed in the early hours of Sunday during an incursion by the Israel Defense Forces (IDF) in the Nur Shams refugee camp near Tulkarem in the occupied West Bank, Palestinian officials said.

title: Netanyahu says Israel nears normalization deal with Saudi Arabia but refuses to outline concessions to Palestinians
author: cnn
content: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu said it is “likely” Israel will reach a normalization agreement with Saudi Arabia, in what would mark a seismic foreign policy shift for both countries as they edge closer to reaching a deal mediated by the US.

title: Israel strikes Gaza targets after incendiary balloons sent across border
author: cnn
content: The Israel Defense Forces (IDF) carried out strikes on what it called Hamas targets in Gaza on Friday, after militants in the enclave launched incendiary balloons towards Israel for the first time in over a year.

title: Netanyahu’s judicial overhaul sparks Palestinian fears of ‘speedy’ West Bank annexation
author: cnn
content: For nearly nine months, tens of thousands of Israelis have protested every week against Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu’s plan to overhaul the judiciary, concerned that it risks severely curtailing the powers of the Supreme Court, the only body that provides a check on the executive and legislative branches of government.

title: Exclusive: Qatar PM touts ‘better environment’ after US-Iran prisoner deal
author: cnn
content: Qatar is “so proud” to have facilitated the return home this week of five US citizens that had been jailed in Iran, said Qatari Prime Minister Mohammed bin Abdulrahman Al-Thani on Tuesday – his first time speaking in depth about Qatar’s role in the episode.

title: Six Palestinians killed by Israeli military in three separate incidents over 24 hours
author: cnn

title: Opinion: The Netanyahu government’s next target: Israel’s free press
author: cnn
content: President Joe Biden must make it clear to Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu that the US will not tolerate his government’s continued attacks on Israel’s democracy, especially on its free press, write Dan Perry and Gilead Sher.

title: Tunisian leader sparks outrage by claiming ‘Zionist movement’ behind naming of storm that battered Libya
author: cnn
content: Tunisian leader Kais Saied has claimed that the “Zionist movement” was behind the naming of Storm Daniel, which brought on massive floods that killed thousands of people in Libya last week, prompting outrage and accusations of antisemitism.

title: UNESCO designates ancient Jericho ruins as World Heritage Site, sparking Israeli ire
author: cnn
content: The United Nations World Heritage Committee voted Sunday to list the Tell es-Sultan archaeological site in Jericho as a “World Heritage Site in Palestine.”

title: UNESCO designates ancient Jericho ruins as World Heritage Site, sparking Israeli ire
author: cnn
content: The United Nations World Heritage Committee voted Sunday to list the Tell es-Sultan archaeological site in Jericho as a “World Heritage Site in Palestine.”

title: Israel’s democracy is at a crossroads as its top court debates a law limiting its power. Here’s what to know
author: cnn
content: Israel’s Supreme Court held hearings Tuesday on a law to curb its powers, in a case that could set the judiciary on a collision course with Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu’s hardline government after months of mass protests over the controversial legislation.

title: Israel’s Arab citizens demand justice after alarming rise in gang-related murders
author: cnn
content: Sajida Abu Salah, clad in all black, is angry.

title: Biden picks Jack Lew as ambassador to Israel
author: cnn
content: President Joe Biden is nominating former US Treasury Secretary Jack Lew as his ambassador to Israel at a fraught moment in US-Israel ties.

title: One of the world’s oldest synagogues reopens in Egypt
author: cnn
content: Egypt has reopened one of the world’s oldest synagogues and home to the most significant single trove of Jewish manuscripts.

title: More than 100 injured in violent disturbances in Tel Aviv involving Eritrean nationals
author: cnn
content: Dozens of people were injured in Tel Aviv on Saturday as hundreds of Eritrean government supporters and opponents clashed with each other and with Israeli police, authorities in Israel said.

title: ‘It brought back memories of Syria.’ For refugees in Sudan, war is a reminder of the terror they left behind
author: cnn

title: US, EU slam far-right Israeli minister’s ‘racist’ claim his rights outweigh that of Palestinians
author: cnn

author: cnn
content: A Palestinian man was critically injured Monday after he was shot from behind by Israeli security forces in the occupied West Bank, according to an eyewitness and video from the scene.

title: Two Israeli civilians killed in flashpoint West Bank town, Israel military says

title: Israel says US approves record-breaking Arrow missile defense deal to Germany

content: The US has approved Israel’s request to sell the Arrow-3 missile system to Germany, the Israeli defense ministry said Thursday, in what will become Israel’s largest ever defense deal.

title: This enclave’s ‘Russian doll’ borders are some of the most complex in the world
author: cnn
content: Nahwa, in the UAE emirate of Sharjah is an enclave within an enclave in an enclave. Its geographical complexity makes it one of only two counter-enclaves in the world.

title: Saudi Arabia appoints first envoy to Palestinians amid talks on Israel normalization
author: cnn
content: Saudi Arabia has appointed its first ambassador to the Palestinians, in a move that comes amid talks with the United States over a possible deal to normalize relations between the Gulf kingdom and Israel.

title: Israeli startups are moving jobs and money out of the country. Here’s why
author: cnn
content: Almost every weekend for more than 30 weeks, tens of thousands of Israelis have taken to the streets of Tel Aviv to protest against government plans to weaken the judiciary and chip away at the independence of the Supreme Court.

title: Lebanon bans ‘Barbie’ movie for ‘promoting homosexuality’
author: cnn
content: The ban comes amid heightened anti-LGBTQ rhetoric by some politicians and government officials in Lebanon and the wider Middle East.

title: Israeli forces say 3 Palestinians killed in occupied West Bank
author: cnn
content: Three Palestinians have been killed by the Israel Defense Forces (IDF) at the Jenin Camp in the occupied West Bank, the IDF announced on Sunday.

title: Two Israelis arrested after Palestinian man killed in West Bank
author: cnn
content: Two Israelis have been arrested for questioning and five others detained following the reported killing of a Palestinian man in the West Bank, Israel Police said in a statement Saturday.

title: Israeli patrolman killed in Tel Aviv shooting, Palestinian gunman also killed
author: cnn
content: An Israeli patrolman was shot and killed in Tel Aviv on Saturday night by a Palestinian gunman who was also shot and killed, Israeli authorities said.

title: Most Israelis oppose the court overhaul. But a minority is backing Netanyahu to the hilt
author: cnn
content: When thousands of people hit Israel’s streets to protest against the passage of the first law in the government’s controversial judicial overhaul plan last week, a smaller group of Israelis was celebrating.

title: Divisive Israeli minister visits key Jerusalem holy site, drawing condemnation
author: cnn
content: Israel’s minister of national security, Itamar Ben-Gvir, on Thursday joined a group of Jewish Israelis in visiting what is known to Jews as the Temple Mount and to Muslims as Haram al-Sharif, or the Noble Sanctuary, drawing condemnation from Palestinian authorities and Israel’s neighbors.

title: Israel’s judicial overhaul sparks military crisis as number of refusing reservists grows
author: cnn
content: As Israel plunges deeper into crisis after the country’s parliament passed the first bill of a controversial judicial overhaul, thousands of Israeli army reservists – the backbone of the Israeli military – are threatening not to show up for work. And Israel’s leaders are sounding alarms about the country’s readiness for war.

title: Israeli Supreme Court to review law that limits its power, setting up showdown with government
author: cnn
content: Israel’s Supreme Court announced Wednesday that it would hear appeals against a controversial new law that curbs its power, setting up a showdown with the government over Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu’s divisive plans to weaken the judiciary.

title: 10,000 reported killed in one West Darfur city, as ethnic violence ravages Sudanese region
author: cnn
content: More than 10,000 people have been killed in the Sudanese region of West Darfur in the past two months, tribal leaders say, amid a deadly conflict between two warring factions that has triggered a mass exodus of refugees from the country and displaced millions internally.

title: Civil unrest, legal appeals and military disobedience: What Israel may face after Supreme Court law change
author: cnn
content: From escalated protests and possible military disobedience, to attempts by the court to rule the new law as invalid, coming days and weeks will test Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu and his far-right coalition’s readiness to defy public opinion.

title: Moody’s warns Israel faces ‘significant risk’ of political and social tensions that will harm its economy, security
author: cnn
content: The controversial overhaul of Israel’s judicial system risks plunging the country into further turmoil that will hurt its economy and security, Moody’s Investors Service warned on Tuesday.

title: Powerful right-wing radicals are testing democratic checks and balance in both Israel and the US
author: cnn
content: White House criticism of Israel after its right-wing coalition embarked on a plan to target judicial power is bringing a new kind of turbulence to one of America’s oldest friendships.

title: In pictures: Israelis protest as lawmakers plan judicial overhaul
author: cnn
content: Israel’s parliament has passed the controversial “reasonableness” bill, the first major legislation in the government’s plan to weaken the judiciary.

title: Israeli government passes law to limit Supreme Court power, defying mass protests
author: cnn
content: Israeli lawmakers on Monday passed a law stripping the Supreme Court of its power to block government decisions, the first part of a judicial overhaul that has sparked six months of street protests and criticism from the White House.

title: Israel passes law to limit Supreme Court power
author: cnn
content: Israeli lawmakers passed the first part of the government’s sweeping plan to weaken the power of the country’s courts, defying months of widespread protests. Get the latest developments here.

title: US calls Israeli judicial overhaul vote ‘unfortunate’
author: cnn
content: The Israeli parliament’s vote stripping the Supreme Court of certain powers is “unfortunate,” the White House says, calling for “consensus” amid major protests.

title: Israel passed a bill to limit the Supreme Court’s power. Here’s what comes next
author: cnn
content: Israel’s parliament on Monday passed the controversial “reasonableness” bill, the first major legislation in the government’s plan to weaken the judiciary, despite six months of protests and American pressure against the most significant shakeup to the court system since the country’s founding.

title: Israeli lawmakers to vote on weakening Supreme Court amid protests, as Netanyahu leaves hospital
author: cnn
content: Israeli lawmakers are set to vote on the first part of the government’s sweeping plan to weaken the power of the country’s courts on Monday, despite six months of street protests, parliamentary maneuvering, compromise talks and increasingly urgent warnings from the White House.

title: Beirut explosion rocks Lebanon’s capital city
author: cnn
content: A massive explosion has rocked the port area of Lebanon’s capital, Beirut. Follow here for live updates.

title: Israelis rally ahead of critical vote to weaken power of courts
author: cnn
content: Thousands of marchers arrived in Jerusalem Saturday, the culmination of a five-day walk from Tel Aviv to protest against Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu’s plans to weaken the powers of Israel’s courts.

title: Israeli president says of US relationship: ‘Our bond may be challenged at times, but it is absolutely unbreakable’
author: cnn
content: Israeli President Isaac Herzog affirmed the US-Israel relationship in an address to a joint meeting of Congress on Wednesday, calling America “our greatest partner and friend,” while also acknowledging criticism from some House progressives.

title: House passes resolution of support for Israel in wake of Jayapal comments
author: cnn
content: The House on Tuesday passed a resolution affirming support for Israel – a direct response to Democratic Rep. Pramila Jayapal’s now walked-back comments about Israel being a “racist” state.

title: Top House Democrats rebuke Jayapal comments that Israel is a ‘racist state’ as she tries to walk them back
author: cnn
content: Top House Democrats are rebuking Congressional Progressive Caucus Chair Pramila Jayapal’s comments from earlier this weekend that “Israel is a racist state,” which she sought to walk back on Sunday.

title: Sweden allows protest burning Torahs and Bibles outside Israeli Embassy
author: cnn
content: Swedish authorities have approved a protest involving the burning of Torahs and Bibles outside the Israeli Embassy in Stockholm, Sweden’s national radio broadcaster reported on Friday.

title: Palestinian leader calls on world to ‘protect us,’ and his people respond with bitter laughter
author: cnn
content: President Mahmoud Abbas, the 87-year-old veteran who has led the Palestinian Authority for nearly two decades, is trending on Palestinian social media – but not in the way he might like.

title: Opinion: After living for so long in Israel, this is the story I had to write
author: cnn
content: Ruth Marks Eglash explains why she, a veteran journalist based in Jerusalem who has covered the Israeli-Palestinian conflict for two decades, turned to writing a novel, ‘Parallel Lines,’ to tell the stories she truly wanted to tell about one of the world’s most polarizing struggles.

title: Israeli protesters stage ‘day of disruption’ against controversial judicial overhaul
author: cnn
content: Tens of thousands of demonstrators took to the streets in Israel on Tuesday in the biggest weekday protest in months against the government’s renewed moves to overhaul the country’s judicial system.

title: Sudanese paramilitary and militias accused of war crimes in West Darfur
author: cnn
content: A new report from Human Rights Watch (HRW) accuses the paramilitary Rapid Support Forces (RSF) and allied Arab militias of executing dozens of people, and “the total destruction” of a town in Sudan’s West Darfur state.

title: Protests across Israel ahead of vote on judicial overhaul bill vote
author: cnn
content: Large crowds of protesters across Israel have come out in the 27th consecutive week of demonstrations against the government’s judicial overhaul plans.

title: Israeli Border Police officer acquitted of charges in the fatal shooting of autistic Palestinian man
author: cnn
content: A Jerusalem court acquitted an Israeli border police officer of “involuntary reckless manslaughter” in the fatal shooting of Eyad al-Hallaq, an unarmed Palestinian man.

title: The Jenin incursion was meant to weaken militant groups. It has ended up deepening the defiance of Palestinian fighters
author: cnn
content: At the gates of Jenin’s government hospital on Wednesday, dozens of armed Palestinian militants and their families gathered to collect their dead, just hours after hundreds of Israeli soldiers withdrew from the city’s sprawling refugee camp.

title: In pictures: Israel’s military operation in Jenin
author: cnn
content: The Israeli military operation in the occupied West Bank city of Jenin ended early on Wednesday, July 5.

title: Angry Palestinians mourn 12 killed in Israeli military operation in Jenin
author: cnn
content: Thousands of Palestinians marched through the streets of Jenin on Wednesday for the funeral of the 12 people killed in Israel’s largest military operation in the occupied West Bank in more than 20 years.

title: Crowds block Tel Aviv’s main artery in anti-government protest
author: cnn
content: Large crowds blocked Tel Aviv’s main highway, and roads in other Israeli cities, in response to the resignation of the city’s police chief.

title: Israel ended a huge military operation in Jenin. Here’s what you need to know
author: cnn
content: Israeli forces have concluded their largest-scale military operation in the occupied West Bank city of Jenin in decades, killing at least 12 Palestinians and leaving widespread destruction across the city’s refugee camp.

title: Eight injured in Tel Aviv car ramming and stabbing attack, Israeli officials say
author: cnn
content: Eight people were injured after a car driver rammed into pedestrians near a Tel Aviv shopping center and then got out of the vehicle to stab civilians, Israeli officials said Tuesday.

title: Israeli forces’ military operation in West Bank’s Jenin continues for second consecutive night
author: cnn
content: Israeli forces continued military operations in the occupied West Bank city of Jenin for a second night, a day after incursions killed at least 10 people between the ages of 16 and 23, and injured about 100 others.

title: Israeli forces launch biggest military operation in West Bank’s Jenin since 2002
author: cnn
content: Israeli forces launched what a military source said is its largest military operation in the occupied West Bank city of Jenin in more than 20 years, killing at least 10 people and injuring about 100 others, according to Palestinian officials.

title: Israeli warplanes target Syrian air defense battery
author: cnn
content: The Israel Defense Forces (IDF) said Sunday that Israeli warplanes had targeted a Syrian air defense battery from which they claimed an anti-aircraft rocket was launched towards Israel.

title: Israel’s Netanyahu says most controversial part of judicial overhaul legislation ‘not coming back’
author: cnn
content: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu said the most controversial aspect of his government’s proposed judicial reform, a provision allowing the national legislature, the Knesset, to overturn Supreme Court rulings, has been dropped and will not be returning.

title: Blinken says US told Israel that violence with Palestinians could jeopardize possible normalization with Saudi Arabia
author: cnn
content: The United States has stressed to Israel that the explosion of tensions with the Palestinians will make it virtually impossible to expand normalization agreements with Arab nations, US Secretary of State Antony Blinken said Wednesday, adding that the Israeli government has taken some escalatory steps, including on settlements.

title: Netanyahu urges Israeli settlers not to ‘grab land illegally,’ following West Bank violence
author: cnn
content: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu issued a stark warning Sunday instructing Jewish settlers not to “grab land illegally” in the occupied West Bank, after humanitarian bodies raised the alarm over a series of deadly attacks on Palestinian villagers.

title: In Jerusalem’s Armenian Quarter, a controversial land deal pits a community against its religious leaders
author: cnn
content: The property controversy comes as Christian Armenians have felt squeezed by Jewish extremists and the ongoing and worsening Israeli-Palestinian conflict.

title: Growing alarm at rise in violence in occupied West Bank
author: cnn
content: The United Nations human rights chief and the European Union have expressed alarm over ongoing violence in the occupied West Bank, and over attacks by settlers on Palestinian villagers. But a prominent member of the government led by Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu has called for illegal settlers’ outposts to be expanded and turned into full settlements.

title: Activists say they’ve identified hundreds of bodies left in the streets of West Darfur
author: cnn
content: Residents of El Geneina, the capital of war-torn West Darfur, are struggling to bury their dead as violence rages across the city.

title: Palestinian villagers attacked in wake of Israeli settler killings, Palestinian official says
author: cnn
content: Hundreds of Israeli settlers attacked the Palestinian village of Turmusayya in the occupied West Bank on Wednesday, the day after the killing of four settlers nearby, according to the mayor of the village.

title: At least four Israelis killed in West Bank shootings, authorities say
author: cnn
content: Four people were killed and four more were wounded in shootings near the settlement of Eli in the West Bank, Israeli authorities and emergency services said Tuesday.

title: Huge firefight erupts as Israeli forces raid Jenin, leaving 5 Palestinians dead
author: cnn
content: An Israeli raid into one of the tensest cities in the occupied West Bank erupted Monday into a massive firefight, leaving at least five Palestinians dead and dozens wounded as the Israeli military struggled to rescue troops under heavy fire.

title: New killings reported in Darfur on second day of Sudan ceasefire
author: cnn
content: Killings and attacks on communities in Darfur by the paramilitary Rapid Support Forces (RSF) and allied militias have been reported “in clear violation” of a fragile ceasefire in Sudan, civil society groups said.

title: Saudi Arabia is quietly changing its textbooks. Could that lead to acceptance of Israel?
author: cnn
content: Textbooks in Saudi Arabia have been changing. For years, researchers have been observing a gradual moderation on subjects ranging from gender roles to the promotion of peace and tolerance.

title: Israel’s military called the settler attack on this Palestinian town a ‘pogrom.’ Videos show soldiers did little to stop it
author: cnn
content: When hundreds of Israeli settlers rampaged through Huwara and surrounding Palestinian towns in the occupied West Bank on February 26, leaving at least one Palestinian man dead and hundreds of others injured, it was billed as “revenge” after a Palestinian gunman killed two brothers who lived nearby.

title: Iran has a new hypersonic missile. Here’s what that means for the Middle East
author: cnn
content: It’s not every day that you see billboards in Hebrew on the streets of Tehran.

title: Israeli forces stage rare incursion into Ramallah to blow up bombing suspect’s home
author: cnn
content: Israeli troops staged a rare incursion into Ramallah, the seat of the Palestinian Authority government in the occupied West Bank, prompting clashes  the Palestinian Ministry of Health said left at least six people wounded.

title: Palestinian boy, 3, dies of injuries days after being shot by Israeli troops
author: cnn
content: A 3-year-old Palestinian boy died Monday, the Palestinian Ministry of Health said, days after he was shot by Israeli troops in the occupied West Bank.

title: Three Israeli soldiers and an Egyptian policeman killed in rare border crossing incident
author: cnn
content: Three Israeli soldiers and an Egyptian policeman have been killed in a rare border crossing incident.

title: Opinion: Why the Israel-Gaza ceasefire is likely a sign of worse to come
author: cnn
content: When it comes to Israel’s conflict with Palestinian organizations in Gaza, the past is sadly prologue more often than not. This weekend’s Egyptian-brokered ceasefire between Israel and Palestine Islamic Jihad after five days of rockets and airstrikes won’t end the conflict even if it holds long enough to resolve this round of fighting, writes Aaron David Miller.

title: Settler attacks on Palestinians in West Bank leave man in critical condition and draw US condemnation
author: cnn
content: Attacks on Palestinians by Israeli settlers in the West Bank on Friday have left a man in critical condition and drawn international condemnation, including from the US government.

title: Contentious Flag March attracts thousands of Israelis to Jerusalem’s Old City
author: cnn
content: Thousands of Israelis waving Star of David flags streamed into the Old City of Jerusalem Thursday, as part of a contentious march taking place at a time of high tensions in the region.

title: We come, we take pictures, we leave: Gaza’s grim routine
author: cnn
content: Now I come once a year for the annual flare up between Gaza militants in Israel. The flare up lasts a few days, maybe a week. I cover it. I leave.

title: Hundreds killed as fighting worsens in Sudanese region of West Darfur
author: cnn
content: Hundreds of people have died in the Sudanese region of West Darfur, as fighting between the two rival military factions battling control in the country escalated as well as drawing in local militia groups.

title: US skips UN Nakba event marking dispossession of Palestinians after Israeli campaign
author: cnn
content: The event, the first of its kind to be held by the UN, commemorated the Nakba or “catastrophe” – when roughly 700,000 Palestinians fled or were expelled from their homes in what is now Israel.

title: Ceasefire between Israel and Islamic Jihad appears to hold after days of violence
author: cnn
content: Life in Gaza quickly appeared to be returning to normal Sunday, the morning after a ceasefire ended five days of intense rocket fire and airstrikes between Palestinian Islamic Jihad and the Israel Defense Forces left 35 people dead – all but one of them Palestinians.

title: Israel and Islamic Jihad agree ceasefire after days of violence
author: cnn
content: Israel and Islamic Jihad agreed to a ceasefire Saturday, after days of violence that have claimed the lives of at least 35 people – almost all of them Palestinians.

title: Islamic Jihad targets Jerusalem for the first time in current conflict as it fires barrage of rockets at Israel
author: cnn
content: Palestinian militants launched rockets towards Jerusalem, Tel Aviv and Israeli settlements in the occupied West Bank on Friday, an escalation of violence in the region that has led to the deaths of at least 33 Palestinians in Gaza and one person in Israel.

title: Israel suffers first rocket death in clash with Islamic Jihad that has left at least 30 Palestinians dead
author: cnn
content: A rocket launched from the Gaza Strip hit a residential building in Israel on Thursday, causing the first Israeli death after days of violence between the two sides that had already claimed at least 30 Palestinian lives.

title: Hundreds of rockets fired at Israel amid deadly IDF airstrikes in Gaza
author: cnn
content: Israel’s army and Palestinian militants exchanged heavy cross-border fire on Wednesday, with hundreds of rockets launched from Gaza towards Israel after the Israel Defense Forces (IDF) carried out deadly strikes on what it says are Islamic Jihad organization targets along the strip.

title: For Syrian refugees, Assad’s rehabilitation prompts fear of forced return
author: cnn
content: For millions of Syrian refugees scattered around the world, the re-admission of the Syrian regime to the Arab family of nations on Sunday may have looked like victory for a dictator who was the very cause of their displacement and misery.

title: Three Islamic Jihad commanders and family members among multiple dead in Israeli strikes on Gaza
author: cnn
content: Three Islamic Jihad commanders and multiple family members were among the 13 Palestinians killed as Israeli jets and helicopters struck multiple targets in Gaza overnight in what Israel described as an operation targeting “kingpin terrorists,” leading to threats of retaliation.

title: US ambassador to Israel expected to depart post this summer, sources say
author: cnn
content: The US ambassador to Israel Tom Nides will depart from his post in August, according to two sources familiar with the matter.

title: Israeli military took no accountability for journalists it killed over past 20 years, press freedom group says
author: cnn
content: A damning new report from a leading press freedom watchdog says it has found no accountability was taken by the Israeli military over its killings of at least 20 journalists over the past two decades.

title: Iran smuggled weapons into Syria using earthquake aid convoys, officials believe
author: cnn
content: Iran smuggled weapons and military equipment into Syria using humanitarian aid shipments as a cover following a devastating earthquake there in February, two sources familiar with US intelligence and an Israeli defense official told CNN.

title: EU cancels Israel reception to avoid far-right minister Ben Gvir
author: cnn
content: The European Union canceled a diplomatic reception to celebrate Europe Day in Tel Aviv due to take place on Tuesday to avoid giving a platform to Israel’s far-right National Security Minister Itamar Ben Gvir, the EU delegation to Israel said Monday.

title: Arab League readmits Syria after 11-year absence
author: cnn
content: The Arab League has re-admitted Syria after an 11-year absence, the organization said Sunday, following an extraordinary meeting at the Arab League’s headquarters in Cairo, Egypt.

title: Arab nations set to rehabilitate Syria’s pariah president in defiance of US
author: cnn
content: Arab nations are set to re-admit Syria into the Arab League despite repeated objections from the United States to ending the decade-long isolation of a regime that it holds accountable for the deaths of more 300,000 civilians and displacement of millions in the country’s brutal civil war.

title: Arab League may have enough votes to bring Syria back into the fold
author: cnn
content: Jordan’s Foreign Minister Ayman Safadi believes there are enough votes among Arab League members for Syria to return to the organization, adding that it is “only the beginning” of bringing a political end to the Syrian crisis.

title: Israel says killers of British-Israeli mother and daughters shot dead in Nablus
author: cnn
content: Israeli forces killed the suspected gunmen who shot dead a British-Israeli mother and two of her daughters last month, Israel Defense Forces spokesperson Richard Hecht told CNN Thursday.

title: Israel military and Palestinians trade fire following hunger striker’s death
author: cnn
content: The Israel Defense Forces (IDF) is conducting strikes on the Gaza Strip, it said in a statement Tuesday.

title: Three injured in Syrian city of Homs after rocket attack
author: cnn
content: Three civilians were injured and a gas station set on fire early Saturday near the Syrian city of Homs in an attack that Syria blamed on Israeli rockets, Syria’s state news agency SANA reported, citing a military official.

title: Clashes renew in West Darfur as food and water shortages worsen in Sudan violence
author: cnn
content: Fighting between Sudan’s military and the Rapid Support Forces (RSF) continued Friday, hours into the latest ceasefire, eyewitnesses in the country said, as officials warned that scores have been killed in “deadly ethnic clashes” in West Darfur’s capital city El Geneina since the beginning of the week.

title: In Jerusalem, DeSantis offers support for Israel and blasts Disney
author: cnn
content: Florida Gov. Ron DeSantis’ war with Disney overshadowed his foreign visit to Jerusalem on Thursday, as he responded to questions about the entertainment giant’s lawsuit against him by saying it lacks “merit.”

title: A divided Israel stands at a perilous crossroads on its 75th birthday
author: cnn
content: Although Israel’s rise has been dramatic, on its 75th anniversary the country also feels like it stands on the brink of a chasm, a crisis of identity, even as it continues to face ever-present external threats.

title: Palestinian reporter breaks barriers by reporting in Hebrew on Israeli TV
author: cnn
content: Maswadeh is something not often seen on Israeli television. He is one of the few Palestinian reporters who report in Hebrew, on Israeli TV.

title: Inside Qatar’s ‘city of the future’
author: cnn
content: Construction of Lusail, Qatar’s newest city, hasn’t even finished, yet it’s already becoming a rival to capital Doha. With striking architecture and real livability, it’s easy to see why.

title: Inside Lusail, Qatar’s ‘city of the future’
author: cnn
content: Lusail, Qatar’s newest city hasn’t even finished construction, yet it’s already becoming a rival to capital Doha. With striking architecture and real livability, it’s easy to see why – and there are even strong historic links marking out the area as special.

title: How Banksy’s Bethlehem hotel inspired celebrity activists to tell the Palestinian story
author: cnn
content: A group of celebrity activists are trying to destigmatize being Palestinian, telling the human stories of an oppressed nation in a new documentary.

title: Israeli police say two men shot near Jewish tomb in Jerusalem in suspected ‘terror attack’
author: cnn
content: Two men have been wounded in what Israeli police say was a suspected “terror attack” that took place near the Shimon Hatzadik tomb in East Jerusalem early Tuesday local time.

title: Inside Al-Aqsa, Muslims say they’re losing control of the holy site
author: cnn
content: On the grounds of the Al-Aqsa complex, one of the most revered places in Islam and Judaism, a delicate balance that governs this holy site is under strain.

title: Palestinian teen killed, Israeli woman dies of wounds as West Bank violence simmers
author: cnn
content: Israeli forces shot and killed a 15-year-old Palestinian boy near the occupied West Bank city of Jericho and an Israeli woman died of wounds sustained in an attack last week, as violence in the region continued to simmer on Monday.

title: Israel says its fighter jets have hit a Syrian military compound
author: cnn
content: Israel launched strikes against Syrian military targets after several rockets were fired from Syria, the Israeli military said.

title: Jordan warns Israel of ‘catastrophic consequences’ if al-Aqsa mosque stormed again
author: cnn
content: Jordan has warned of “catastrophic consequences” if Israeli forces were to storm the al-Aqsa mosque again.

title: Italian tourist killed in Israel car-ramming attack
author: cnn
content: An Italian tourist was killed and seven people wounded in a car-ramming attack in the Israeli city of Tel Aviv on Friday evening.

title: Attacks in West Bank, Tel Aviv as tensions remain high following Israeli strikes
author: cnn
content: Separate attacks in the West Bank and Tel Aviv killed three people on Friday after Israel struck Palestinian militant targets in southern Lebanon and Gaza, concluding three days of rising tensions in the region following police raids on the al-Aqsa mosque in Jerusalem.

title: The situation in Jerusalem is boiling over. Here’s how it all happened
author: cnn
content: Israel said it struck targets belonging to the Palestinian militant group Hamas in southern Lebanon and Gaza early Friday, hours after dozens of rockets were fired from southern Lebanon into Israeli territory, which the Israeli military blamed on Palestinian militants.

title: Israeli police storm al-Aqsa mosque for the second time on Wednesday
author: cnn
content: Israeli police stormed the al-Aqsa mosque in Jerusalem, one of Islam’s holiest sites, for the second time on Wednesday, hours after they first raided the compound and arrested hundreds of Palestinians despite condemnations from the Arab and Muslim world.

title: Israeli military veterans, a backbone of protest movement, vow to keep demonstrating
author: cnn
content: In a sea of Israeli flags, Yiftach Golov holds one that looks a little different. One of many protesters who again took to the streets on Saturday, the military veteran hoists a brown flag that represents a group called “Brother and Sisters in Arms.”

title: Palestinian man shot dead in disputed circumstances near Jerusalem’s al-Aqsa compound
author: cnn
content: A Palestinian man was shot and killed by Israeli police early on Saturday at the entrance to the al-Aqsa mosque compound in Jerusalem, frequently a flashpoint in tensions between Israel and the Palestinians.

title: Taxi driver narrowly escapes right-wing Israeli mob
author: cnn
content: A tiny Jerusalem gas station was an unlikely setting for a cautionary tale about Israel’s political evolution.

title: Biden and Netanyahu trade barbs over plan to weaken courts as Israel rejects ‘pressure’ from White House
author: cnn
content: Israel’s embattled Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu escalated a rare public dispute with US President Joe Biden on Tuesday, rejecting “pressure” from the White House after Biden criticized his controversial efforts to weaken the Israeli judiciary.

title: Netanyahu is backed into a corner. Here’s what he may do next
author: cnn
content: The only wiggle room the Israeli leader has is if negotiators reach a moderated judicial overhaul plan bill over the recess period, and where concessions to his right-wing coalition members need not be too extreme.

title: DeSantis plans to travel to Jerusalem as tumult strains Netanyahu-Biden relationship
author: cnn
content: Florida Gov. Ron DeSantis will deliver an address next month in Jerusalem, a trip that is certain to inject the likely Republican presidential contender into Israel’s national tumult and its increasingly fraught relationship with the United States.

title: In pictures: Protests erupt in Israel over judicial reform
author: cnn
content: For months, hundreds of thousands of Israelis have been taking to the streets to protest proposed changes to the country’s legal system.

title: Opinion: The biggest lesson from Israel’s political crisis
author: cnn
content: Frida Ghitis writes that the weeks of demonstrations protesting Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu’s judicial overhaul reforms offer a sharp rebuke to those who believe democracy is a moribund system.

title: Israel’s judicial overhaul delayed after mass protests and strikes
author: cnn
content: Israel’s judicial overhaul legislation will be put on hold until the next session of the Knesset, after the Passover recess in April, Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu announced in a televised address following a day of protests. Follow live updates here.

title: Why Israel’s instability matters to the US
author: cnn
content: The pictures from Israel are incredible: seas of protesters rising up across the country. The flashpoint is the prime minister’s controversial plan to change the country’s judicial system. Here’s why all this matters for the US.

title: Netanyahu announces delay to Israel judicial overhaul plans amid huge protests
author: cnn
content: Embattled Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu was forced to back down on controversial plans to overhaul the country’s judiciary on Monday, amid widespread strikes and protests as well as mounting international pressure.

title: White House scales up ‘concern’ rhetoric, marking rare involvement in Israeli domestic affairs
author: cnn
content: A week after President Joe Biden spoke by phone with Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu to urge him to find a compromise on his planned judicial reforms, events on the ground in Israel continue to generate deep concern inside the White House – particularly as Biden prepares to highlight global democracy during a major summit this week.

title: ‘Historic’ strikes leave Israel at standstill with crowds in streets to protest judicial reform
author: cnn
content: Israel’s political crisis escalated into uncharted territory Monday as the country’s largest trade union announced a “historic” strike shutting down transportation, universities, restaurants and retailers in protest against Prime Minister’s Benjamin Netanyahu’s planned judicial overhaul.

title: A threat to democracy or much-needed reform? Israel’s judicial overhaul explained
author: cnn
content: Fresh protests are expected in Israel against far-reaching changes to the country’s legal system some say threaten Israel’s democratic foundations.

title: Mass protests erupt in Israel after Netanyahu fires minister who opposed judicial overhaul
author: cnn
content: Massive crowds filled the streets of the Israeli city of Tel Aviv late Sunday night after Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu fired his defense minister over his opposition to a planned judicial overhaul.

title: Why the Syrian drone strikes and US retaliation may yet be a big deal
author: cnn
content: The US has conducted an airstrike in Syria against what it said were Iranian-affiliated facilities after a suspected Iranian drone struck a facility housing US personnel in the country, killing an American contractor and wounding five US service members.

title: Why American Jews are distancing themselves from Netanyahu’s government
author: cnn
content: This month, 145 American Jewish leaders publicly distanced themselves from a member of the Israeli government. It was a rare public rebuke of a sitting Israeli minister that brought together individuals from across the Jewish-American political spectrum.

title: Israeli minister says there’s ‘no such thing as a Palestinian people,’ inviting US rebuke
author: cnn
content: Israel’s far-right Finance Minister Bezalel Smotrich denied the existence of a Palestinian people or nationhood over the weekend, prompting a rebuke from the United States just weeks after calling for a Palestinian town to be “erased.”

title: At least 4 Palestinians killed in IDF operation in Jenin
author: cnn
content: At least four Palestinians were killed on Thursday and 23 others injured after an Israeli Defense Forces (IDF) operation in Jenin, in the occupied West Bank, according to the Palestinian Authority Health Ministry. At least five of the injured are in critical condition, the health ministry added.

title: Half a million Israelis join latest protest against Netanyahu’s judicial overhaul, organizers say
author: cnn
content: About 5% of the country’s population took to the streets in the tenth consecutive week of protests against plans by the government of Benjamin Netanyahu to overhaul the country’s judicial system, organizers claimed.

title: Saudi Arabia looks for security assurances from US as condition for normalizing ties with Israel
author: cnn
content: Saudi Arabia is looking to the United States for security guarantees and help with its civilian nuclear program as a condition for normalizing relations with Israel, according to people familiar with the matter, setting up a critical decision that could reshape the political situation in the Middle East.

title: US defense chief jabs at Netanyahu’s plan to weaken courts as protesters block Israeli airport
author: cnn
content: US Defense Secretary Lloyd Austin took a swipe at Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu’s plan to weaken Israel’s judicial system as protesters paralyzed two of Tel Aviv’s main travel arteries on Thursday, intensifying a nationwide movement against the controversial proposals.

title: Six Palestinians, including suspected Hamas gunman, killed in Israeli raid
author: cnn
content: Israeli forces staged a daylight raid into Jenin in the occupied West Bank targeting the suspect in the killing of two Jewish settlers, leaving the suspect and at least five other Palestinian men dead, officials on both sides said Tuesday.

title: Inside the Palestinian town that far-right Israeli minister wants ‘erased’
author: cnn
content: Villagers there told CNN that they would normally expect the Israeli military to protect them from settler attacks but that on Sunday they did not. The top Israeli general in the West Bank admitted the IDF was unprepared for the scale of the settler violence against Palestinians.

title: US condemns Israel far right minister’s call for Palestinian town ‘to be erased’
author: cnn
content: Israel’s far-right finance minister’s call for a Palestinian town “to be erased” was harshly condemned by US State Department spokesperson Ned Price on Wednesday, who described the comments as “repugnant” and “irresponsible.”

title: Abu Dhabi’s stunning new multi-faith complex is a mosque, synagogue and church
author: cnn
content: The United Arab Emirates on Wednesday inaugurated the “Abrahamic Family House,” an interfaith complex housing a mosque, a church, and the Gulf Arab state’s first ever purpose-built synagogue.

title: Gulf states have given billions in aid to Egypt. Now they want to see returns
author: cnn
content: Egyptian President Abdel Fattah el-Sisi last month sent a message to his Gulf allies. “The most important point here is support from our brothers,” he said at the World Government Summit (WGS) in Dubai, where he was guest of honor.

title: US citizen killed in West Bank as Israeli-Palestinian tensions rise
author: cnn
content: An Israeli-American citizen was killed in the occupied West Bank as tensions in the region continued to ratchet up after a weekend of violence.

title: Israeli military calls settler attacks on Palestinians ‘actions of terror’ after weekend of violence
author: cnn
content: The Israel Defense Forces (IDF) sees the previous day’s attacks by Israeli settlers against Palestinians in the West Bank as “actions of terror,” an IDF official said Monday, as tensions in the region simmered after a weekend of violence.

title: Netanyahu’s crises mount as Israeli-Palestinian tensions ratchet up
author: cnn
content: Benjamin Netanyahu has not even been back in power two months, and already he faces unprecedented, multi-faceted challenges on nearly every front.

title: House GOP committees plot investigations into East Palestine derailment
author: cnn
content: A series of House Republican committees are plotting to launch investigations into the toxic train disaster in East Palestine, Ohio, multiple committee aides told CNN.

title: Two Israeli settlers killed in West Bank shooting, days after Israeli raid kills 11 Palestinians
author: cnn
content: Two Israeli settlers were shot and killed in the West Bank on Sunday, local settler leader Yossi Dagan said, calling it “an extremely serious terrorist attack.” The shooting sparked revenge attacks by Israeli settlers against Palestinians, causing at least one death and numerous injuries.

title: About 160,000 people protest against Netanyahu’s judicial overhaul in Tel Aviv
author: cnn
content: About 160,000 people demonstrated in Tel Aviv Saturday night against the Israeli government’s plans to weaken the country’s judicial system, crowd expert Ofer Grinboim Liron told CNN. That would make it one of the biggest single demonstrations yet against the legislation.

title: Israeli incursion shatters lives in ancient Middle Eastern city
author: cnn
content: The heart of occupied Nablus is one of the most ancient cities in the Middle East. With two churches, 12 mosques and a Samaritan synagogue around densely populated residential areas, the occupied West Bank city’s nickname is “Little Damascus” because of the way its architecture, arches and even the local accent and food are reminiscent of those of the Syrian capital.

title: 11 Palestinians killed during Israeli raid targeting militants in West Bank
author: cnn
content: At least 11 Palestinians were killed Wednesday during a rare daytime raid by Israeli military forces in the occupied West Bank that also left more than 100 injured, Palestinian officials said in the aftermath of an operation described by the local director of Red Crescent as a “massacre.”

title: All eyes were on Morocco at the last World Cup. Now, Palestinian national team wants a slice of the action at 2026 tournament
author: cnn
content: The Palestinian team has never taken part in a World Cup tournament, but the territory’s presence was very much in evidence at Qatar 2022.

title: Israel launches airstrikes on Gaza after rocket attacks as violence escalates
author: cnn
content: Israel launched airstrikes targeting alleged weapons manufacturing and storage sites in Gaza on Thursday, following a rocket attack from the coastal enclave, the Israel Defense Forces (IDF) said.

title: Opinion: Netanyahu’s ‘reforms’ are threatening the very foundations of Israel’s democracy
author: cnn
content: The far-right government of Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu is trying to overhaul the system of checks and balances that maintain political stability in the country, writes Dan Perry. Israel’s friends would be wise to speak up, he says.

title: Protests across Israel as Netanyahu’s government introduces bill to weaken courts
author: cnn
content: A controversial set of bills that would weaken the independence of Israel’s judicial system passed its first reading in the Knesset, Israel’s parliament, in the early hours of Tuesday morning local time.

title: Roman-era sarcophagus found in Gaza
author: cnn
content: A Roman-era lead sarcophagus was uncovered on Tuesday at the site of a 2000-year-old Roman necropolis in the Gaza Strip.

title: Palestinian activist beaten by Israeli soldier tells CNN he is scared for his life
author: cnn
content: Palestinian activist Issa Amro, who was filmed being assaulted by an Israeli solder on Monday, told CNN he is physically and psychologically affected by the attack and fears for his life.

title: Syria’s Assad hopes quake can help free him from global isolation
author: cnn
content: Eight days after a devastating earthquake struck Turkey and Syria, a relief plane touched down in the Syrian city of Aleppo, marking one of the biggest diplomatic feats for the country’s isolated regime in over a decade.

title: Dual US-Jordanian citizen imprisoned in Jordan on sedition charges launches hunger strike
author: cnn
content: A US citizen detained in Jordan is calling on the US government to demand his return to the United States and launching a hunger strike to protest his imprisonment. Bassem Awadallah, a dual US-Jordanian citizen, was arrested in April 2021 and sentenced to 15 years in prison on charges of incitement against the state and sowing sedition.

title: Palestinian man killed and 13 injured in Israeli raid in West Bank, say Palestinian officials
author: cnn
content: A Palestinian man was killed and 13 were injured in an Israeli raid in Nablus early Monday, Palestinian health officials said, in what Israeli authorities said was an operation to arrest suspects in the fatal shooting of an Israeli soldier last year.

title: Thousands protest Netanyahu’s plan to weaken Israel’s judiciary as president warns of ‘social collapse’
author: cnn
content: Tens of thousands of flag-waving Israelis converged on the Israeli parliament, the Knesset, Monday, amid warnings that Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu’s plan to weaken the country’s judiciary risks plunging the country into a “social collapse.”

title: Israeli forces raid Jenin, killing 14-year-old boy, Palestinian officials say
author: cnn
content: Israeli forces raided the West Bank city of Jenin on Sunday, killing a 14-year-old boy, the Palestinian Ministry of Health said. Qusai Radwan Waked was shot in the abdomen, the ministry said.

title: Second child dies in car ramming attack in Jerusalem
author: cnn
content: A car drove into several people at a bus stop in Jerusalem on Friday, killing a man and a young child in what Israeli police described as a “ramming terror attack.” A second child died of his injuries Saturday.

title: Palestinian man, 27, shot and killed by Israeli settler in the West Bank, Palestinian officials say
author: cnn
content: A Palestinian man was shot and killed by an Israeli settler in the West Bank on Saturday, the Palestinian Ministry of Health said, naming him as Mithqal Suleiman Abdel Halim Rayan, 27.

title: As aid is rushed into Turkey, Syria could be left behind
author: cnn
content: Syrian victims of the devastating earthquake that hit their country and Turkey on Monday may become hostages of the politics that have divided Syria for over a decade, analysts have warned.

title: Traumatized and afraid, Jenin residents are still reeling from Israeli raid
author: cnn
content: Mohammed Abu al-Hayja was sleeping alongside his wife and two young daughters last month when loud gunfire woke them up. Minutes later, Israeli soldiers rammed down his door and burst through his apartment.

title: Israel and Sudan finalize text of peace agreement, says Israeli foreign minister
author: cnn
content: Israel and Sudan have finalized the text of a peace agreement to be signed “later this year,” Israeli Foreign Minister Eli Cohen announced on Thursday.

title: Israel targets Gaza with airstrikes after intercepting rocket attack
author: cnn
content: Israel carried out airstrikes in Gaza early on Thursday after intercepting a rocket attack from the coastal enclave, the Israel Defense Forces (IDF) said.

title: Opinion: Netanyahu wants peace, but offers few solutions
author: cnn
content: Almost five decades after Kissinger’s ‘shuttle diplomacy’ brought a degree of stability to Israeli-Arab relations, “there is still no Palestinian state and relations between Israelis and their Palestinian neighbors are as fraught as ever,” writes David A. Andelman.

title: Netanyahu outlines vision for two-state solution – without Palestinian sovereignty
author: cnn
content: Netanyahu signaled clearly that it is extremely unlikely Israel and the Palestinians will make any measurable progress toward a long-term peace anytime soon.

title: ‘It’s all empty promises’: Palestinians feel betrayed by US, warn there’s only so much they can bear
author: cnn
content: Abu A’asem brews pot after pot of his specialty Arabic coffee, despite the pouring rain. His corner stand at the heart of Ramallah is always busy, no matter the weather, but his future as a Palestinian is very much as gloomy as the skies above.

title: Exclusive: Netanyahu says don’t get ‘hung up’ on peace with Palestinians first
author: cnn
content: Israel’s Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu said people can get “hung up” on peace negotiations with the Palestinians, saying he has opted for a different approach in an interview with CNN’s Jake Tapper on Tuesday.

title: Blinken visit reaches new urgency as Israeli, Palestinian tensions boil
author: cnn
content:
US Secretary of State Antony Blinken’s trip to Israel and the West Bank may have been in the works for weeks, but it couldn’t come at a more pressing time. 
Both Palestinians and Israelis have suffered bloodshed in the last few days, and fears are growing that the situation will spiral out of control.

title: Israel was behind drone attacks at military plant in Iran, US media report
author: cnn
content: US officials believe drone attacks at a military plant in Iran’s central city of Isfahan were carried out by Israel, according to US media reports.

title: Settlements to be ‘strengthened’ in wake of Jerusalem attacks, Israeli PM says
author: cnn
content: Israel will “take steps to strengthen settlement” in response to shooting attacks in Jerusalem Friday and Saturday, Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu has said.

title: Two wounded in shooting in Jerusalem, police say, after synagogue attack leaves seven dead
author: cnn
content: Two people were wounded in a shooting attack in Jerusalem on Saturday, emergency services say, the day after a gunman killed at least seven people near a synagogue in the city.

title: At least seven dead in Jerusalem synagogue attack, Israeli police say
author: cnn
content: Israeli police say at least seven people were killed and three were injured in a shooting near a synagogue in Jerusalem on Friday amid high tensions in Israel and the Palestinian territories.

title: Blinken to visit Israel and West Bank with tensions high after outbreak of violence
author: cnn
content: US Secretary of State Antony Blinken’s trip to Jerusalem and Ramallah next week has gained new urgency after a wave of deadly violence in Israel and the West Bank.

title: Lethal Israeli raid marks deadliest day in over a year
author: cnn
content: Israeli forces killed nine Palestinians and wounded several others in the West Bank city of Jenin on Thursday, the Palestinian Ministry of Health said, prompting the Palestinian Authority to suspend its security coordination with Israel.

title: As Israel bans Palestinian flags, one artist protests with his brush
author: cnn
content: This month, new Israeli National Security Minister Itamar Ben Gvir ordered police to take down Palestinian flags in any public place in Israel, claiming they are a rallying symbol for terrorists. At least one Israeli artist felt forced to respond to Ben Gvir’s decree.

title: US and Israel launch largest military exercise ever despite concerns over Netanyahu’s government
author: cnn
content: The US and Israel launched their largest joint military exercise ever on Monday, sending a clear signal to Iran and underscoring the strength of their alliance despite concerns over the composition of the new Israeli government which includes ultra-nationalist and ultra-religious parties.

title: Netanyahu dismisses key ally Aryeh Deri after High Court order
author: cnn
content: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu dismissed key ally Aryeh Deri from all ministerial posts on Sunday, complying with an Israeli High Court ruling that it was unreasonable to appoint the Shas party leader to positions in government.

title: Lebanon to restore UN payments ‘immediately’ after losing voting rights in General Assembly
author: cnn
content: Lebanon vowed to restore its payments to the UN’s operating budget on Friday after losing its right to vote in the 193-member UN General Assembly, according to the country’s state-owned National News Agency (NNA).

title: Israel’s democracy on the brink amid supreme court showdown with Netanyahu
author: cnn
content: Israel’s highest court this week ordered Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu to fire a key ally, a dramatic move amid an unprecedented confrontation between his government and the judiciary.

title: US has moved munitions stored in Israel for use by Ukraine
author: cnn
content: The United States has transferred American munitions stored in Israel for use in Ukraine and plans to send more soon, US and Israeli officials told CNN Wednesday.

title: More than 80,000 people turn out for Tel Aviv protest against Netanyahu government
author: cnn
content: Tens of thousands of people protested in Tel Aviv Saturday night against Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu and his government’s proposed changes to the Israeli judicial system.

title: Why an Arab nation has opted to teach the Holocaust in its schools
author: cnn
content: The United Arab Emirates will soon become the first Arab nation to teach the horrors of the Nazi Holocaust in its schools, a historic move that has been praised in some quarters – but also criticized in others.

title: Israel’s Ben Gvir orders police to take down Palestinian flags, testing limits of his authority
author: cnn
content: Itamar Ben Gvir, Israel’s new hard-right national security minister, has ordered police to remove any Palestinian flag flown in public, arguing that displaying it shows “identification with terrorism.”

title: Israel’s rightward shift leaves its new Arab allies in an awkward spot
author: cnn
content: The public embrace of figures that are hated in the Arab world – and are divisive within Israel itself – is a rare gesture on the part of Arab states that have normalized relations with Israel.

title: Israel’s far-right Ben Gvir visits flashpoint Jerusalem holy site as Palestinians slam ‘provocation’
author: cnn
content: Israeli far right national security minister Itamar Ben Gvir visited the compound of Jerusalem’s Al Aqsa mosque, known as Temple mount in Judaism, on Tuesday in a move that drew Palestinian condemnation and stood against Israeli warnings.

title: Benjamin Netanyahu sworn in as leader of Israel’s likely most right-wing government ever
author: cnn
content: Benjamin Netanyahu Thursday completed a dramatic return as Israel’s prime minister, after being sworn in as the leader of what is likely to be the country’s most right-wing government in history.

title: Jordan king warns of ‘red lines’ in Jerusalem as Netanyahu returns to office
author: cnn
content: Jordan’s king says he is prepared for conflict should the status of Jerusalem’s holy sites change as Israel prepares to swear in what is likely to be the most right-wing government in its history.  “If people want to get into a conflict with us, we’re quite prepared,” he said.

title: Netanyahu informs Israeli president he has formed government
author: cnn
content: Benjamin Netanyahu has officially informed Israeli President Isaac Herzog that he has successfully formed a government, his Likud party said Wednesday.

title: Ismail Haniyeh Fast Facts
author: cnn
content: Read Fast Facts from CNN about Ismail Haniyeh, Hamas leader in Gaza.

title: Israel deports French-Palestinian lawyer, accusing him of ‘terrorist activity’ in case Israeli group calls ‘gross violation of basic rights’
author: cnn
content: Israel deported a French-Palestinian lawyer it accused of organizing, inciting and planning “terrorist attacks” to France early Sunday morning, Israeli authorities said, in a case that an Israeli human rights organization called a “gross violation of basic rights.”

title: How the Arab world’s most populous country became addicted to debt
author: cnn
content: Egypt has dug itself a massive hole of debt. On Friday, the International Monetary Fund (IMF) will extend a $3 billion loan to the country, a fourth aid package in six years, as its financial tailspin continues.

title: Family of Palestinian activist Nizar Banat files case against Palestinian Authority in International Criminal Court
author: cnn
content: The family of a Palestinian activist who died while in Palestinian Authority custody has filed a “war crimes and torture” case with the International Criminal Court, they said Thursday.

title: UN agency says Israel is delaying new visas for its staff
author: cnn
content: A United Nations agency that operates in the West Bank and Gaza says Israel is not processing visas for its newly recruited staff, while Israeli officials accuse the agency of “ignoring Israeli victims of terror” in East Jerusalem and the occupied West Bank.

title: Israeli military admits shooting 16-year-old Palestinian girl, calls it ‘unintentional’
author: cnn
content: The Israeli military admitted Monday that its troops shot Jana Zakarneh, a 16-year-old Palestinian girl who died during a raid in the occupied West Bank on Sunday night, saying she was killed by “unintentional” Israeli fire “aimed at armed gunmen.”

title: Israeli journalists experience chilly reception at Qatar World Cup
author: cnn
content: When  direct flights were announced from Tel Aviv to Doha for the World Cup, the scene at Ben Gurion airport was festive. But Israeli reporters sent to cover the tournament say they’re experiencing a less than welcoming atmosphere.

title: Body of Israeli Druze young man seized by Palestinians in Jenin returned to his family - Israeli military
author: cnn
content: The body of an Israeli Druze young man that was seized by Palestinian gunmen in Jenin has been transferred to his family, the Israeli military said on Thursday, adding that nothing had been given in return.

title: Palestinian gunmen seize body of Israeli Druze teen from hospital in Jenin, demanding exchange of bodies
author: cnn
content: Palestinian gunmen stormed a hospital in Jenin and seized the body of a young Israeli Druze civilian who had been in a car accident in the West Bank, authorities on both sides of the conflict said Wednesday. The gunmen are demanding the return of the bodies of Palestinians killed by Israeli troops, they said.

title: 15-year-old student dead after 2 explosions rock Jerusalem
author: cnn
content: Two explosions shook Jerusalem early Wednesday, killing one person and injuring more than dozen, Israeli police said.

title: World Cup makes history with direct flights from Israel to Qatar
author: cnn
content: For the first time direct flights from Tel Aviv, Israel to Doha, Qatar will ferry fans to one of the sporting world’s biggest events – and between two countries that have no diplomatic relations.

title: Opinion: Dr. Nasser ‘Nas’ Mohamed sought asylum in the US after coming out as gay. Here’s what he wants people to know about Qatar
author: cnn
content: Dr. Nasser “Nas” Mohamed is said to be the first gay Qatari to come out publicly. He did it to raise awareness about the existence and mistreatment of LGBTQ people in Qatar before the 2022 FIFA World Cup. “Our voices and our journeys matter,” he says.

title: CNN obtains exclusive photos of drone attack aftermath on Pacific Zircon tanker ship
author: cnn
content: CNN has obtained exclusive images showing the damage and debris from a self-detonating drone attack against an oil tanker off the coast of Oman on Tuesday evening.

title: At least 21 dead after fire breaks out in Gaza residential building, says Interior Ministry
author: cnn
content: At least 21 people, including whole families and children, were killed when a fire broke out at a residential building in a refugee camp in northern Gaza on Thursday, according to Palestinian authorities in Gaza.

title: Israel accuses Iran of drone attack on oil tanker off Oman coast
author: cnn
content: A self-destructing drone attacked an oil tanker in the Gulf of Oman on Monday evening, according to a US military official, but did not cause major damage.

title: Three Israelis killed in attack in occupied West Bank
author: cnn
content: At least three Israelis were killed and another three wounded when a Palestinian man went on a rampage near an Israeli settlement in the occupied West Bank on Tuesday.

title: Israel reveals US probe into Shireen Abu Akleh’s death but says it ‘will not cooperate’
author: cnn
content: A top Israeli official has confirmed the existence of a US investigation into the killing of Palestinian-American journalist Shireen Abu Akleh but said Israel’s government would not cooperate with the American probe, calling it a “mistake.”

title: Netanyahu to be invited to form government, paving way for return of Israel’s longest-serving leader
author: cnn
content: Israel’s President Isaac Herzog announced Friday he will invite Benjamin Netanyahu to form Israel’s next government, paving the way for him to take the country’s top job for a record sixth time and extend his record as the nation’s longest-serving leader.

title: FIFA announces shared flights for Israeli and Palestinian football fans for 2022 World Cup in Qatar
author: cnn
content: FIFA announced on Thursday that shared flights have been organized to permit Israeli and Palestinian fans into Qatar to watch the 2022 FIFA World Cup. The temporary direct charter flights between Ben Gurion Airport in Tel Aviv and Hamad International Airport in Doha, Qatar, represent the only official direct flights between the two nations.

title: Israel Prime Minister Yair Lapid congratulates Benjamin Netanyahu on election victory
author: cnn
content: Israeli Prime Minister Yair Lapid called Benjamin Netanyahu to congratulate him on winning Israel’s elections, the prime minister’s office announced Thursday, just under 48 hours after polls closed.

title: A far-right surge is set to put Netanyahu back in power. Who are his extremist allies?
author: cnn
content: Israel’s longest-serving prime minister, Benjamin Netanyahu, looks set to storm his way back into power, with partial election results suggesting he and his allies have won a clear majority of seats in the Knesset.

title: Netanyahu is back. Here’s what that means for Israel
author: cnn
content: Benjamin Netanyahu is set to resurrect his political career and make an astonishing comeback as Prime Minister of Israel. And after five elections in four years, this government might just stick.

title: Netanyahu on course to lead Israel’s most right-wing government ever, partial Israel results suggest
author: cnn
content: Benjamin Netanyahu appears to be on course for a bigger victory in Israel’s fifth election in less than four years than initial exit polls suggested, all three of the country’s main television channels projected Wednesday morning.

title: Netanyahu on brink of comeback as Israeli exit polls point to narrow majority for ex-PM
author: cnn
content: Former Israeli leader Benjamin Netanyahu was on the verge of making a triumphant return to office in Israel, as initial exit polls suggested he may have scraped a narrow majority in the country’s fifth national election in less than four years.

title: Netanyahu eyes comeback as Israel votes in fifth election in four years
author: cnn
content: Israelis are heading to the ballot box for an unprecedented fifth time in four years on Tuesday, as Israel holds yet another national election aimed at ending the country’s ongoing political deadlock.

title: Five elections in four years: What’s the deal with Israeli politics?
author: cnn
content: Stop us if you’re heard this one before: On Tuesday, Israelis are going to the polls to elect a new Knesset, or parliament. It’s the fifth time in less than four years that voters are casting ballots. Holding elections that often is bound to prompt some questions. Here are some answers.

title: West Bank militants threaten Israel, urge Palestinian leaders to join resistance as tensions rise
author: cnn
content: Four US-made M4 Carbine rifles lean against the back of the sofa. The young men, mostly dressed in black civilian clothes, are relaxed and chatty. Neighbors pop their heads in to say hello through a door open to the street.

title: Australia repatriates families of ISIS fighters from Syria
author: cnn
content: Australia has repatriated a group of women and children who were left stranded in refugee camps in northeastern Syria after the Islamic State (ISIS) terror group lost control of the area in 2019.

title: Israel and Lebanon finalize Mediterranean border agreement, opening up potentially rich oil and gas fields
author: cnn
content: Israel and Lebanon finalized an agreement defining their maritime borders in the Mediterranean on Thursday, President Joe Biden announced on Twitter, inking a United States-brokered deal at the United Nations mission on the land border between the countries.

title: Israeli President says he is ‘extremely pleased’ with Kanye West fallout after antisemitic remarks
author: cnn
content: Israeli President Isaac Herzog on Wednesday said he is “extremely pleased” with the “overwhelming reaction” to recent antisemitic comments from rapper and fashion designer Ye, also known as Kanye West.

title: Six killed by Israeli forces in the deadliest day for Palestinians this year
author: cnn
content: Israel said it was targeting Lion’s Den, a new militant group which emerged in Nablus this year and has targeted Israeli soldiers, killing at least two.

title: Life gets more unbearable for Palestinians in Jerusalem’s only refugee camp
author: cnn
content: The people of this isolated, poverty-stricken island of refugees from the wars of 1948 and 1967 have never had it easy. But in the past two weeks, conditions at the Shuafat camp in East Jerusalem have become even more unbearable.

title: Australia reverses Trump-era recognition of West Jerusalem as capital of Israel
author: cnn
