content: The Australian government has reversed a decision by its predecessor to recognize West Jerusalem as the capital of Israel, prompting a rebuke from the Israeli government.

title: Trump complains American Jews don’t appreciate his moves on Israel, drawing criticism
author: cnn
content: Former President Donald Trump on Sunday criticized American Jews for what he argued was their insufficient praise of his policies toward Israel, warning that they need to “get their act together” before “it is too late!”

title: East Jerusalem rocked by sixth night of clashes as Israeli raids in West Bank leave at least two Palestinians dead
author: cnn
content: Clashes erupted in the flashpoint East Jerusalem neighborhood of Sheikh Jarrah and in the West Bank for a sixth consecutive night overnight Thursday into Friday, leaving at least two Palestinians dead.

title: Leading Palestinian factions sign reconciliation deal, aiming to pave way to elections
author: cnn
content: More than 15 years after a violent break between leading Palestinian factions Hamas and Fatah, Algeria has brokered an apparent reconciliation, with the signing of a unification agreement announced on Thursday.

title: 5 ways the Israel-Lebanon maritime deal matters
author: cnn
content: Amid decades of hostility, Lebanon and Israel on Tuesday reached a historic maritime border deal, finally demarcating a disputed area in the Mediterranean sea that is believed to be rich in oil and gas.

title: Israel and Lebanon reach historic agreement, paving the way to potentially rich gas exploration
author: cnn
content: Israel and Lebanon have reached a historic agreement, leaders on each side said separately on Tuesday, settling a years-long maritime border dispute involving major oil and gas fields in the Mediterranean.

title: Violent weekend as four Palestinians killed in West Bank, Israeli soldier killed in Jerusalem shooting
author: cnn
content: An Israeli soldier has died following a shooting at a military checkpoint in East Jerusalem on Saturday, the Israel Defense Forces (IDF) said on Twitter.

title: One man killed, two journalists injured during Israeli military raid in West Bank
author: cnn
content: A Palestinian man was killed and two journalists shot and injured by Israeli forces during an Israeli military raid in the occupied West Bank, Palestinian authorities said Wednesday.

title: Former Lebanese ambassador holds sit-in at Beirut bank amid new wave of heists
author: cnn
content: A former Lebanese ambassador held a sit-in at his bank outside of the capital city of Beirut on Tuesday, refusing to leave until he received his money, his wife has told CNN.

title: Australia to rescue families of ISIS fighters from Syria
author: cnn
content: Canberra is set to rescue dozens of Australian women and children of ISIS fighters from refugee camps in Syria, following a secret mission by the country’s security intelligence agency, media reported on Monday.

title: Thousands attend funeral for 7-year-old who died, Palestinians say, in Israeli troops chase
author: cnn
content: Thousands of Palestinians turned out Friday to mourn a seven-year-old Palestinian boy who died, his father said, while being chased by Israeli troops on Thursday – an account rejected by the Israeli army but which prompted the US State Department to call for an investigation.

title: How a debate over textbooks closed 150 schools in East Jerusalem
author: cnn
content: On September 19, some 150 schools in East Jerusalem went on strike, keeping tens of thousands of students out of the classroom, to protest the introduction of Israeli textbooks. Parents say Israel is trying to erase their identity by pushing an Israeli narrative.

title: At least 4 Palestinians killed, dozens wounded in one of year’s deadliest Israeli West Bank raids
author: cnn
content: At least four Palestinian men were killed and 44 wounded during an Israeli military raid and heavy clashes in Jenin Wednesday morning, Palestinian officials said, making it one of the deadliest days in the West Bank this year, which has already seen over 100 Palestinians killed.

title: Fears of a third Intifada as Palestinian deaths reach 7-year high
author: cnn
content: More than 97 Palestinians killed by Israeli forces so far this year in the West Bank, making it the deadliest year in the West Bank for Palestinians killed by Israeli soldiers since 2015.

title: Farmer uncovers stunning Byzantine-era mosaic in Gaza orchard
author: cnn
content: An ornate Byzantine floor mosaic showing a variety of colorful birds and other animals has been discovered by chance in Gaza after a Palestinian farmer tried to plant new trees on his land.

title: Five soldiers killed by Israeli airstrikes, Syria says
author: cnn
content: Five Syrian soldiers were killed in Israeli airstrikes that targeted Damascus International Airport and other areas near the capital, the Syrian Defense Ministry said on Saturday.

title: Disney’s new Israeli superhero film hits a raw nerve with Arabs
author: cnn
content: Critics say many of the Arab characters Sabra interacted with in the comics are shown as misogynistic, antisemitic and violent, and are questioning whether the troubling portrayals of Arabs will play out differently in the film.

title: Palestinian killed and 16 others injured by Israeli troops in West Bank demolition operation
author: cnn
content: A Palestinian man was shot dead and 16 others were wounded during an Israeli military operation in Jenin in the West Bank, the Palestinian Ministry of Health said Tuesday.

title: Israel U-turns on relationship rules for West Bank
author: cnn
content: One of the most controversial rules required foreigners entering a relationship with a Palestinian in the West Bank to notify Israeli authorities within 30 days.

title: Hamas executes five in Gaza, including two accused of spying for Israel
author: cnn
content: Hamas executed five Palestinians in Gaza, including two on charges of cooperating with Israel, the militant group announced on Sunday – the first known executions in Gaza in more than five years.

title: Forty years on, Hezbollah is isolated but more powerful than ever
author: cnn
content: Over the years, the Lebanese Shiite group has tried to rebrand itself from a paramilitary organization backed by Iran to a serious political and regional player.

title: US and Israeli agencies use new agreement to defend against cyberattacks
author: cnn
content: The US and Israeli governments have shared key details of unrelated cyberattacks on their infrastructure – one from suspected pro-Russia hackers and the other from possible Iranian hackers – as part of heightened efforts in recent months to bolster cyber defense between the two allies, a senior US Treasury official told CNN.

title: Lakes are drying up everywhere. Israel will pump water from the Med as a solution
author: cnn
content: Israel is experimenting with desalinating sea water to replenish a freshwater lake. If it works, it could offer a solution to many other countries where lakes are drying up.

title: Outrage over Palestinian leader’s ‘50 Holocausts’ remark
author: cnn
content: Palestinian Authority President Mahmoud Abbas struck a deep nerve on Tuesday when he said Israel has caused “50 Holocausts” against Palestinians, triggering outrage from world leaders and a social media storm.

title: US-led coalition forces repel drone attack near base in Syria
author: cnn
content: US-led coalition forces repelled multiple drones near the US-led coalition At-Tanf base in Syria Monday, according to a press release from the coalition.

title: Five Americans among injured in Jerusalem shooting attack
author: cnn
content: At least eight people, including five Americans, were wounded in a shooting attack targeting a bus near the Western Wall in Jerusalem’s Old City early Sunday morning.

title: Three Palestinians killed as Israel launches new raid against suspected militants in the West Bank
author: cnn
content: Three Palestinian men were killed during an Israeli military operation against suspected militants in the occupied West Bank on Tuesday morning, according to information from the Palestinian health ministry.

title: Ceasefire between Israel, Gaza militants holds after deadliest clashes in a year
author: cnn
content: A ceasefire between Israel and the Islamic Jihad militant group in Gaza was holding on Monday after a weekend of hostilities left dozens of Palestinians dead.

title: Why Hamas stayed out of the latest Gaza conflict
author: cnn
content: One of the most important aspects of last weekend’s short but violent conflict between Israel and the Palestinian Islamic Jihad was what didn’t happen: Hamas’ involvement.

title: More than 40 people killed in Gaza in weekend of violence
author: cnn
content: Palestinian militants launched rockets toward Jerusalem on Sunday, after Israeli airstrikes in the Gaza Strip overnight killed a senior militant commander – the second since Israel’s operation against Islamic Jihad began.

title: Gaza escalation continues into second day as Israel clashes with Islamic Jihad
author: cnn
content: The Israeli military campaign against Islamic Jihad went into its second day Saturday evening with continued airstrikes on what it said were militant targets in Gaza.

title: Ben & Jerry’s says Unilever froze directors’ salaries over Israel
author: cnn
content: Ben & Jerry’s independent board said parent company Unilever, with which it is locked in a dispute over the sale of its Israeli business, had frozen its directors’ salaries in July as a pressure tactic ahead of a mediation on the matter.

title: Beirut’s port blast two years on: An open wound festers as authorities try to close the case
author: cnn
content: Thursday marks two years since a deadly blast ripped through Beirut’s port. Now, the port’s hulking wheat silos – which withstood the effects of the explosion despite their proximity – have been ablaze for weeks.

title: Israel’s Prime Minister makes rare allusion to country’s nuclear weapons arsenal
author: cnn
content: Israel’s Prime Minister Yair Lapid made a rare allusion to the country’s widely suspected nuclear arsenal during a speech on Monday.

title: Lebanon’s national basketball team gives crisis-stricken country a glimmer of hope
author: cnn
content: The people of Lebanon were given a much-needed reason to smile this week after the Cedars – Lebanon’s national basketball team – fought their way to the finals of the International Basketball Federation (FIBA) Asia Cup.

title: Russian threats to close Jewish Agency strike a nerve in Israel
author: cnn
content: Israeli officials are trying to tamp down the diplomatic fracas that has erupted in recent weeks as Moscow has sought to dissolve the Jewish Agency’s Russian branch, an organization that helps Jews emigrate to Israel.

title: Saudi Arabia opens airspace to Israeli flights
author: cnn
content: Saudi Arabia on Friday opened its airspace to all civilian carriers, including all flights to and from Israel, in a step toward normalizing relations between the two nations as US President Joe Biden tours the Middle East.

title: A ‘Middle East NATO’? Why Iran is closely watching Biden’s regional trip
author: cnn
content: Biden’s visit comes just weeks after Israel said that it was working with regional partners on an air defense alliance that is led by the US but Iran sees it as a provocative move and a threat against its national security.

title: Biden says diplomacy is still the best way to keep Iran from getting a nuclear weapon, despite Israeli skepticism
author: cnn
content: President Joe Biden on Thursday said the US will not allow Iran to acquire a nuclear weapon and that he believed diplomacy remained the best avenue to keep the nation from obtaining one, despite Israeli objections over a deal with the Islamic Republic.

title: Secret Service member returns to US following altercation in Israel
author: cnn
content: A member of the US Secret Service Counter Assault Team was detained by the Israeli national police in Jerusalem this week after he allegedly assaulted a woman outside of a bar, a source tells CNN, and the Secret Service says the agent is on his way back to the US.

title: Progressive pro-Israel group takes on AIPAC in Michigan Democratic primary fight
author: cnn
content: The contentious Democratic House primary in Michigan’s 11th District, which pits two incumbents against each other after the state redrew its congressional map, has quietly become one of the key battlegrounds in the party’s evolving rift over Israel and overlapping debates about its broader ideological direction.

title: ISIS leader in Syria killed in drone strike, US says
author: cnn
content: The US carried out a drone strike in northwest Syria on Tuesday that killed Maher al-Agal, the leader of ISIS in Syria, US Central Command said.

title: What not to expect from Biden’s Jerusalem trip
author: cnn
content: It has taken President Joe Biden almost eighteen months to schedule a visit to Jerusalem, and the White House has made it clear from the start it has no interest in investing any political capital in re-starting peace negotiations.

title: Israeli and Palestinian leaders speak by phone for the first time in years
author: cnn
content: Israel’s new Prime Minister Yair Lapid and the Palestinian Authority President Mahmoud Abbas held a phone conversation Friday morning, which is believed to be the first such contact between Israeli and Palestinian leaders for five years.

title: Ben & Jerry’s sues Unilever to block sale of Israeli business
author: cnn
content: Ben & Jerry’s is suing its parent company in an attempt to cancel the sale of its business in Israel to a local partner that would continue to distribute its products in the West Bank.

title: A leader for all Israelis? Yair Lapid takes over as caretaker prime minister
author: cnn
content: Lapid has dabbled in acting, screenwriting, music and even amateur boxing, before becoming best known to the Israeli public as a journalist-turned-politician. Now, he will be entering his biggest spotlight yet.

title: Magnificent ancient mosaic found near Tel Aviv returns home
author: cnn
content: An exceptionally well-preserved Roman floor mosaic, showing a rich variety of fish, animals, birds and ships, has returned to the site where it was first found in a Tel Aviv suburb after a decade-long tour of some of the world’s top museums.

title: Israeli parliament votes to dissolve, triggering fifth election in four years
author: cnn
content: The Israeli parliament, the Knesset, voted Thursday to dissolve itself, triggering new elections.

title: Ben and Jerry’s sells its Israeli business
author: cnn
content: Unilever has sold its Ben & Jerry’s business in Israel to its distributor in the country, following ongoing controversy related to its activities in Israel and the West Bank.

title: US strikes al Qaeda-affiliated leader in Syria
author: cnn
content: The US carried out a strike in Syria on Monday targeting a senior leader of Hurras al-Din, an al Qaeda-affiliated terrorist organization, according to a statement from US Central Command.

title: Is there any way out of Israel’s neverending election cycle?
author: cnn
content: A fifth round of elections in less than four years will likely be held in Israel. And even though Netanyahu is facing ongoing corruption trial, he could be back in power in a matter of months.

title: Israel set for possible fifth election in four years as PM Bennett moves to dissolve parliament
author: cnn
content: Israel’s Prime Minister Naftali Bennett has effectively called time on his premiership after just a year in the job.

title: Why enemies Lebanon and Israel are talking now
author: cnn
content: Lebanon and Israel, officially at a state of war, are holding indirect talks in an effort to settle a border dispute with potentially billions of dollars at stake.

title: How a failed vote on Jewish settlers shows the Israeli government is teetering
author: cnn
content: Efforts by Netanyahu and his allies to bring down  Israel’s governing coalition risk hurting the very cause the Israeli right has always championed: Jewish settlers in the West Bank.

title: UN-mandated rights inquiry rebukes Israel for seeking ‘complete control’
author: cnn
content: An independent commission of inquiry set up by the UN Human Rights Council after the 2021 Gaza war said Israel must do more than end the occupation of land Palestinians want for a state, according to a report released on Tuesday.

title: How the UAE went from boycotting Israel to investing billions in its economy
author: cnn
content: Nearly two years ago, the UAE formally ended its near-half-century boycott, and on Tuesday, it became the first Arab country to sign a free trade agreement with the Jewish state.

title: Israelis lament ‘racism problem’ as Jerusalem march turns ugly
author: cnn
content: The Jerusalem Day flag march has become a magnet for far-right Jewish extremists, some of whom were chanting “death to Arabs,” and “Arabs are sons of b*tches.”

title: Violence erupts around Jerusalem during controversial flag march
author: cnn
content: Thousands of Israelis marched in a controversial flag-waving procession through east Jerusalem on Sunday, after Palestinian factions warned the event could ignite a new round of tensions.

title: 14-year-old Palestinian shot and killed by Israeli forces, says Palestinian health ministry
author: cnn
content: A 14-year-old Palestinian boy was shot and killed by Israeli forces in the West Bank town of Bethlehem late Friday, according to the Palestinian Ministry of Health.

title: Al Jazeera’s Abu Akleh killed by Israeli forces using armor-piercing bullet, Palestinian Authority investigation says
author: cnn
content: A Palestinian Authority investigation into the killing of journalist Shireen Abu Akleh has found that she was fatally shot by Israeli forces using an armor-piercing bullet, Palestinian Attorney General Akram Al-Khatib said Thursday.

title: Israeli judge’s ruling on Jews who prayed in Al-Aqsa compound ignites controversy
author: cnn
content: A court in Jerusalem has issued a controversial ruling that critics say threatens the fragile agreement regulating access to Jerusalem’s most disputed holy sites.

title: Palestinian teen shot and killed in exchange of fire with Israeli military in Jenin
author: cnn
content: A 17-year-old Palestinian was killed and an 18-year-old was critically injured by Israeli fire during an Israeli military raid in Jenin in the West Bank Saturday, the Palestinian Ministry of Health said.

title: Israeli lawmaker resigns over ‘harassment’ of Palestinians, plunging government into parliamentary minority
author: cnn
content: Israel’s fragile government lost its parliamentary majority on Thursday after an Arab-Israeli lawmaker resigned from the ruling coalition, accusing its leaders of fueling tensions between Israelis and Palestinians and condemning the violent intervention of police at the funeral of slain journalist Shireen Abu Akleh.

title: Will Hezbollah’s election setback change anything in Lebanon?
author: cnn
content: Iran-backed Hezbollah lost its parliamentary edge in a high-stakes election last weekend. For Lebanon, this could mean everything, or nothing at all.

title: Hezbollah’s coalition loses parliamentary majority in Lebanon’s first vote after uprising, financial collapse
author: cnn
content: Iran-backed Hezbollah has lost its parliamentary coalition majority in a Lebanese election that delivered significant gains to its rivals as well as to a protest movement that swept the country in a 2019 uprising.

title: Opponents of Jerusalem cable car plan lose Israeli Supreme Court case
author: cnn
content: Israeli and Palestinian opponents of an Israeli plan to run a cable car over Jerusalem to the walls of the Old City lost their Supreme Court case Sunday against a project they argued would alter its ancient landscape.

title: Israeli police will investigate ‘events’ surrounding funeral of  Palestinian journalist: Minister
author: cnn
content: Israeli police say they will hold an investigation “into the events that ensued during the funeral” procession of Al Jazeera journalist Shireen Abu Akleh on Friday.

title: Lebanese take their fight with a century-old political order to the ballot box
author: cnn
content: On Sunday, Lebanese citizens will vote for a new parliament for the first time since an October 2019 uprising demanded the fall of a century-old political order. Whether this year’s election will deliver a new political makeup is far from certain.

title: Thousands mourn slain journalist Shireen Abu Akleh as Palestinians call for accountability
author: cnn
content: Thousands of mourners gathered in the West Bank city of Ramallah on Thursday to mourn slain Al Jazeera journalist Shireen Abu Akleh, as the Palestinian Authority vowed to take the case to the International Criminal Court.

title: Al Jazeera journalist Shireen Abu Akleh shot dead while covering Israeli military operation in West Bank
author: cnn
content: Palestinian-American Al Jazeera journalist Shireen Abu Akleh was fatally shot while covering an Israeli military operation in the West Bank city of Jenin on Wednesday.

title: Shireen Abu Akleh, journalist killed in the West Bank, was ‘the voice of Palestinian suffering’
author: cnn
content: The veteran Palestinian-American journalist was a household name in the Arab world, chronicling the suffering of Palestinians for two-and-a-half decades for millions of viewers.

title: Biden considering visit to East Jerusalem, Israeli official says
author: cnn

title: Two suspects arrested after Israeli Independence Day attack leaves three dead
author: cnn
content: Israeli security services say they arrested two suspects Sunday following a gun and axe attack Thursday night in the central Israeli city of Elad, which left three people dead.

title: Palestinians vow to stay on West Bank land despite defeat in decades-old legal battle
author: cnn
content: The leader of a Palestinian village council in the West Bank vowed Friday to continue fighting eviction from land the Israeli military is claiming as a firing range, despite an Israeli Supreme Court decision against the Palestinians in a case that has been in court for more than two decades.

title: At least three killed in suspected terror attack in Israel
author: cnn
content: At least three people were killed and four injured in a suspected terror attack in the central Israeli city of Elad on Thursday, according to Israel’s emergency response services.

title: Is Lavrov’s Hitler remark the last straw for Israel?
author: cnn
content: In the months since Russia invaded Ukraine, Israel has tried to maintain a delicate diplomatic balancing act. But comments made by Russian Foreign Minister Sergey Lavrov have hit a raw nerve.

title: Chaos as American family brings unexploded shell to Israel airport
author: cnn
content: An American family caused havoc at Israel’s Ben Gurion airport in Tel Aviv on Thursday when they tried to transport an unexploded shell through airport security.

title: Jerusalem violence puts century-old status quo to the test
author: cnn
content: A recent spike in violence at some of Jerusalem’s key holy sites has left Jordan in a difficult position vis-a-vis its nearly century-old custodial obligations in the city. Following clashes at al-Aqsa, Jordan feels like it has been left with little choice than to issue statements of condemnation from 100 kilometers away.

title: Palestinian farmer finds 4,500-year-old goddess statue while working his land
author: cnn
content: A Palestinian farmer working his land in Gaza has uncovered the head of a 4,500-year-old statue of Canaanite goddess Anat.

title: Six drown off Lebanon coast after overloaded boat capsizes, says Lebanese navy
author: cnn
content: An overloaded boat transporting around 60 migrants who were fleeing Lebanon for an unknown destination capsized near the northern port of Tripoli on Saturday evening, according to the Lebanese Red Cross.

title: Clashes erupt in Jerusalem, Israel responds to Gaza rockets with airstrikes
author: cnn
content: Palestinians and Israeli security forces clashed early Thursday around the entrance to the Al-Aqsa Mosque in Jerusalem’s Old City and Israel responded to rockets fired from Gaza with airstrikes, as the worst tensions in months continued to simmer.

title: Israeli PM Naftali Bennett says security decisions taken in Jerusalem and Gaza are ‘not political’
author: cnn
content: Israel Prime Minister Naftali Bennett told CNN that security steps taken by the Israeli government in Gaza and Jerusalem were not politically motivated.

title: Israeli government’s fragility laid bare as violence spikes
author: cnn
content: Israel’s United Arab List party this week suspended its membership in the historically diverse coalition to protest what it said was police violence in Jerusalem. Never before in Israeli history has the fate of a government been in the hands of an Arab, non-Jewish party.

title: As the Iran nuclear deal nears, Saudi Arabia is rebuilding its stake in Lebanon
author: cnn
content: Lebanon’s Prime Minister Najib Mikati is due to visit Saudi Arabia in the next two weeks, a first trip by  a Lebanese premier to the Arab powerhouse in almost four years following an unprecedented rupture in relations. Michael Young, of the Carnegie Middle East Center in Beirut, told CNN what this means for the Saudi-Lebanese relationship and for the region.

title: Jerusalem on edge as violence flares at key holy site
author: cnn
content: Palestinians and Israeli forces have clashed in and around the Al Aqsa mosque in Jerusalem’s Old City, marking a significant spike in tensions on what is a day of significance for all three of the city’s main religions.

title: Hundreds mourn Palestinian boy killed by Israeli forces as both sides report violence across the West Bank
author: cnn
content: Hundreds of people have turned out for the funeral of a 14-year-old Palestinian boy shot dead by Israeli soldiers in the West Bank village of Husan.

title: As violence spikes, the killing of an unarmed Palestinian mother highlights awful toll of occupation
author: cnn
content: Ghada Sabateen, an unarmed mother of six, died from her wounds after being shot in the legs by Israeli forces near a checkpoint in the West Bank, after the Israeli army said she failed to heed verbal warnings and ran toward them. Her children say she was “full of love and kindness” and always tried to stay out of conflict.

title: Three deaths in separate incidents highlight sky-high tensions in Israel, West Bank
author: cnn
content: Israeli forces shot and killed two Palestinian women in separate incidents in the West Bank on Sunday, further heightening tensions between Israelis and Palestinians after weeks of deadly attacks. In a third incident, a Jewish man was shot dead in Israel after allegedly trying to steal a gun being carried by a soldier.

title: Two killed, many injured in Tel Aviv shooting
author: cnn
content: Two people were killed and more than a dozen others wounded in a shooting at a bar in a busy area of Tel Aviv late on Thursday, Israeli officials said.

title: Israel’s coalition government loses its majority as right-wing lawmaker quits
author: cnn
content: Israel’s government was dealt a major blow on Wednesday when coalition chairwoman Idit Silman resigned, depriving the government of its majority.

title: UAE sentences Israeli woman to death for cocaine possession
author: cnn
content: A court in the United Arab Emirates has sentenced an Israeli woman to death, after she was found guilty of possessing 500 grams of cocaine. The woman – named by Israeli media as 43-year old Fidaa Kiwan – is appealing the sentence.

title: Israel and the West Bank are on edge again. Here are five things you need to know
author: cnn
content: A series of terror attacks and violent incidents have put Israel and the Palestinian territories on edge again.

title: Five people shot dead near Tel Aviv, the third attack in Israel in a week
author: cnn
content: Five people were shot dead by a Palestinian gunman near Tel Aviv on Tuesday, Israeli police said, marking the third such attack in Israel within a week.

title: What one meeting in Israel says about a changing world order
author: cnn
content: A landmark meeting in Israel this week sheds light on the emerging global multipolarity and how Middle Eastern states adjust to the new realities by realigning their alliances.

title: Lawmakers are starting to grumble about Israel’s lack of action in Ukraine
author: cnn
content: A number of lawmakers on Capitol Hill are growing increasingly frustrated with what they see as Israel’s lack of action in response to Russia’s ongoing invasion of Ukraine.

title: ISIS attack kills two and injures six in Israel as Arab and Israeli officials hold historic summit
author: cnn
content: ISIS operatives killed two people and injured six in a shooting attack Sunday in the Israeli city of Hadera, some 31 miles north of Tel Aviv, Israeli officials said.

title: Russia’s invasion of Ukraine puts Israel in a tricky spot
author: cnn
content: Israel has been walking a tightrope between Ukraine and Russia for several weeks. That’s largely due to security considerations on its northern border, where Russia has a large military presence.

title: Israel’s fraught Russia-Ukraine balancing act
author: cnn
content: Aaron David Miller writes one could be forgiven for thinking that as America’s closest ally in the Middle East, Israel would provide unwavering support for the Ukrainians. But Israel’s unique interests in the region are forcing Jerusalem to navigate a course that tries to avoid alienating both Russian leader Vladimir Putin and President Joe Biden.

title: Ben & Jerry’s stops making ice cream in Israel. Its Israeli manufacturer is suing
author: cnn
content: Ben & Jerry’s decision to stop manufacturing ice cream in Israel sparked a lawsuit from its Israeli distributor.

title: Israel to open borders to unvaccinated tourists March 1
author: cnn
content: Israel plans to open its borders to all tourists, no matter their Covid-19 vaccination status, starting March 1.

title: Funerals for three suspected Palestinian militants killed in West Bank by Israeli forces attract large crowds
author: cnn
content: Large crowds turned out in the West Bank city of Nablus Tuesday for the funerals of three men shot dead by Israeli forces.

title: Israel’s police under fire amid further allegations of ‘Pegasus’ cybersurveillance use against public figures
author: cnn
content: Israel’s government is set to consider opening a commission of inquiry into the police amid growing anger over the alleged police use of Pegasus hacking software against a wide array of senior public figures.

title: President Biden to visit Israel ‘later this year,’ White House says
author: cnn
content: President Joe Biden will visit Israel “later this year” after Israeli Prime Minister Naftali Bennett invited him to the country, according to a readout of a call between the two on Sunday released by the White House.

title: UAE intercepts and destroys 3 ‘hostile’ drones
author: cnn
content: Three hostile drones were intercepted over the United Arab Emirates at dawn on Wednesday, the country’s defense ministry said.

title: Amnesty accuses Israel of apartheid over treatment of Palestinians, prompting angry response
author: cnn
content: Amnesty International has become the latest human rights organization to accuse Israel of apartheid for its treatment of Palestinians, prompting an angry response from Israel, which has denounced the report as anti-Semitic.

title: How Qatar went from regional outcast to key Biden ally
author: cnn
content: Qatar is on its way to becoming a major non-NATO ally of the United States, a sign of its growing relevance to Washington’s global agenda. Here’s how it got there.

title: US, UAE intercepts ballistic missile during Israeli President’s visit
author: cnn
content: The United States joined the United Arab Emirates (UAE) on Monday to intercept and destroy a ballistic missile as the Israeli President was in the country on a historic visit, according to authorities. The attack marks the third such incident in January.

title: 27 drug smugglers killed at Jordan-Syria border, Jordanian army says
author: cnn
content: Jordanian soldiers killed 27 armed drug smugglers as they tried to enter the country from Syria on Thursday, an army spokesman said.

title: UAE summons people for sharing videos of missile attack interception
author: cnn
content: The United Arab Emirates public prosecutors’ office said on Wednesday it had summoned several people for sharing videos showing defense systems intercepting Monday’s missile attack by Yemen’s Houthi movement.

title: Israeli settlers rage through Palestinian town, marking the latest ‘nationalistically motivated’ attack in the region
author: cnn
content: Israeli settlers in a convoy of cars rampaged through a Palestinian town in the West Bank near Nablus on Monday evening, marking the latest in a string of violent incidents involving settlers in recent months.

title: Israeli officials deny report that police are using cellphone spying software on citizens without court approval
author: cnn
content: Israeli officials are denying parts of a report that says they used NSO hacking software Pegasus to spy on civilians – including leaders of protest movements – without the required legal permissions.

title: Palestinian family home demolished in sensitive East Jerusalem neighborhood
author: cnn
content: A Palestinian family has been removed from their home in the Sheikh Jarrah neighborhood in East Jerusalem in an overnight operation carried out by Israeli police.

title: A drone attack in Abu Dhabi could mark a dangerous turning point for the Middle East. Here’s what to know
author: cnn
content: A deadly drone attack in the heart of the United Arab Emirates’ capital has thrust the Middle East into uncharted waters at a time when the region’s leaders have sought to heal years-long rifts.

title: Saudi led-coalition launches airstrikes on Yemeni capital after deadly Houthi drone strike in Abu Dhabi
author: cnn
content: The Saudi led-coalition fighting in Yemen launched airstrikes on the Yemeni capital on Monday, shortly after Iranian-backed Houthi rebels claimed responsibility for a deadly drone attack in the United Arab Emirates.

title: Jerusalem Post website hacked on Soleimani assassination anniversary
author: cnn
content: Israel’s Jerusalem Post newspaper said on Monday its website had been hacked, in what it said was an apparent threat to the country.

title: Saudi and Israeli foreign ministers joined recent State Department virtual meeting on Omicron
author: cnn
content: US Secretary of State Antony Blinken’s virtual meeting with foreign ministers about the Omicron coronavirus variant last week included the ministers from both Saudi Arabia and Israel, a rare instance where the two countries who do not have formal diplomatic relations participated in the same call.

title: Lebanon’s soul has been eviscerated by its financial crisis. Not even the children want to play
author: cnn
content: Beirut feels both familiar and utterly foreign. In the Beirut of today people go through the motions and the energy that once made the city vibrant has dissipated. It had an energy of being alive, and that’s all gone.

title: Thousands of cranes killed by bird flu in ‘worst blow to wildlife’ in Israel’s history
author: cnn
content: An outbreak of avian flu has killed more than 5,000 migratory cranes in Israel, prompting authorities to declare a popular nature reserve off-limits to visitors and warn of a possible egg shortage as poultry birds are culled as a precaution.

title: Israel announces plan to double Golan Heights population, drawing condemnation from Syria
author: cnn
content: Israel said on Sunday that it intends to double the population of the contested area of the Golan Heights in the coming years, drawing the ire of the Syrian government.

title: Trump uses anti-Semitic tropes to again criticize Jewish Americans
author: cnn
content: Former President Donald Trump, in a newly released interview, claimed that Jewish Americans “either don’t like Israel or don’t care about Israel,” while also suggesting that evangelical Christians “love Israel more than the Jews in this country.”

title: Suspected car-ramming attack by Palestinian teen highlights rising tensions, amid questions over Israeli police actions
author: cnn

title: Israeli Prime Minister meets UAE Crown Prince in Abu Dhabi in historic visit
author: cnn
content: For the first time in history an Israeli Prime Minister has made an official visit to the United Arab Emirates.

title: The trip could have killed them. But people fleeing economic wreckage in the Middle East say they’d do it 100 times over
author: cnn
content: Across the Middle East and North Africa, talk of emigration is rampant. Though guns have largely fallen silent in most of the region’s conflict zones, much of the misery has not let up.

title: Hamas ammunition warehouse explodes causing casualties in southern Lebanon
author: cnn
content: A Hamas warehouse filled with ammunition at a Palestinian refugee camp in southern Lebanon exploded on Friday, causing casualties, according to Lebanon state-run NNA news.

title: Jordan bows to Palestinian pressure and pulls ‘sperm smuggling’ film
author: cnn
content: Jordan has withdrawn its entry to the Oscars after criticism that the film “Amira” was disrespectful to Palestinian prisoners and their families.

title: We know who is attacking us and we know how to get even, says Israel’s cyber defense chief
author: cnn
content: In a nondescript office park in the desert town of Be’er Sheva, a “war room” filled with screens showing various maps, rolling information, and graphics inform around a dozen or so staffers, manning computers at the central heart of Israel’s civilian cyber defense system.

title: Qatar 2022: Amid ongoing human rights concerns, World Cup chief promises host nation is ‘tolerant’ and ‘welcoming’
author: cnn
content: With less than a year to go before the start of the 2022 FIFA World Cup, questions surrounding host nation Qatar’s handling of humanitarian issues show few signs of abating – specifically concerning the state’s anti-homosexuality laws.

title: Lebanese protesters block roads over economic meltdown
author: cnn
content: Demonstrators, some of them burning tyres, blocked roads across parts of Lebanon on Monday in protest at the country’s economic meltdown, days after the Lebanese pound sank to new lows.

title: What the world could learn from Israel’s Covid-19 vaccine booster rollout
author: cnn
content: More than three months after Israel started rolling out boosters, health officials say the data is clear: third shots have helped bring down the fourth wave of Covid-19 that swept the country in August and September.

title: Hamas gunman kills one Israeli, injures four others, in Jerusalem attack; police shoot dead assailant
author: cnn
content: A 26-year old Israeli man has died after a Hamas gunman carried out a shooting attack in Jerusalem’s Old City.

title: Islamic State claims responsibility for Uganda bombings
author: cnn
content: The Islamic State has claimed responsibility for two separate suicide attacks that killed three people and injured 36 in the Ugandan capital, Kampala, on Tuesday.

title: UAE foreign minister meets Assad, in highest-profile Emirati visit to Syria since start of war
author: cnn
content: The United Arab Emirates Foreign Minister Sheikh Abdallah bin Zayed met Syrian President Bashar al-Assad in Damascus on Tuesday, in the most senior Emirati visit to the country since the start of Syria’s war in 2011.

title: Israel doubles down against US, saying there is no room in Jerusalem for an American Consulate for Palestinians
author: cnn
content: Sitting next to the Israeli Foreign Minister in Washington this October, Secretary of State Antony Blinken was clear: The Americans want to re-open their consulate in Jerusalem to serve Palestinians.

title: Sheikh Jarrah families facing threat of forced eviction reject Israeli high court proposal
author: cnn
content: Seven Palestinian families facing the threat of forced eviction from their homes in the east Jerusalem neighborhood of Sheikh Jarrah have rejected a proposal from Israel’s High Court that justices said could resolve the decades-long dispute.

title: Missile attack on mosque and religious school kills and injures 29 Yemeni civilians, says minister
author: cnn
content: A Houthi ballistic missile attack on a mosque and a religious school killed and injured 29 civilians, including women and children, in the Yemeni province of Marib, the country’s information minister said in a statement on Twitter on Monday.

title: Israeli settlement plans in the West Bank draw condemnation from US, UK, Europe
author: cnn
content: Israel’s plan to greenlight thousands of new Israeli housing units in the West Bank is drawing outcry from the US, UK and a dozen European countries.

title: Netflix launches a ‘Palestinian Stories’ collection featuring award-winning films
author: cnn
content: Netflix has released a film collection dedicated to sharing Palestinian stories in a move a Palestinian filmmaker is calling “bold.”

title: Israel labels six Palestinian civil society groups ‘terrorist,’ setting challenge for international donors
author: cnn
content: Israel’s government has declared six Palestinian civil society groups supported by the international community as terrorist organizations, prompting dismay among human rights campaigners.

title: Drone attack targets US troops at US base in Syria, initial assessment suggests no US injuries
author: cnn
content: A “deliberate and coordinated” attack utilizing drones and indirect fire targeted US troops at the US base at At-Tanf in Syria, close to the border with Jordan, on Wednesday, according to US Central Command, which oversees operations in the Middle East.

title: How an investigation into Beirut’s port explosion is rattling Lebanon’s elite, stirring memories of civil war
author: cnn
content: For many in Lebanon, Thursday’s scenes from central Beirut brought a sense of deja vu.

title: Beirut’s worst street violence in more than a decade kills at least 6
author: cnn
content: A fierce political dispute over a probe into Beirut’s August 2020 port blast prompted the worst violence Lebanon has witnessed in more than 10 years on Thursday, after a protest descended into deadly street battles. At least six people were killed.

title: FIFA president floats Israel as possible World Cup 2030 co-hosts
author: cnn
content: FIFA President Gianni Infantino has floated the prospect that Israel might co-host the World Cup in 2030, according to Israeli Prime Minister Naftali Bennett.

title: Trump’s inner circle takes a trip down memory lane in Jerusalem
author: cnn
content: For a few short hours in Jerusalem this week, the Trump band got back together for a glitzy reunion gig.

title: State electricity returns in Lebanon but still maxes out at two hours in most areas
author: cnn
content: Lebanon’s main state electricity company supplied around two hours of power to the national grid, local residents told CNN on Sunday, a day after the country was reported to have disconnected from its grid due to fuel depletion.

title: Union Berlin apologizes over anti-Semitic incidents at match against Maccabi Haifa
author: cnn
content: German soccer club Union Berlin has apologized after anti-Semitic incidents were reported during the UEFA Europa Conference League match against Israeli team Maccabi Haifa on Thursday.

title: US condemns attack by West Bank settlers on Palestinian villagers
author: cnn
content: Five people, two minors among them, have been detained by Israeli police after an attack by Jewish settlers on a Palestinian village in the West Bank.

title: Kamala Harris’ office doing clean-up after exchange with student on Israel
author: cnn
content: Vice President Kamala Harris’s office is trying to contain the fallout from an exchange earlier this week between the vice president and a student who characterized Israel’s actions toward Palestinians as “an ethnic genocide and a displacement of people.”

title: Five Palestinians killed, two arrested by Israeli forces in West Bank
author: cnn
content: Five Palestinians have been killed and two arrested Saturday night as part of a days-long operation targeting Hamas in the West Bank, the Israel Defense Forces said.

title: Hezbollah threatened top judge probing Beirut port blast, source says
author: cnn
content: Hezbollah has threatened to “usurp” the Lebanese judge investigating the Beirut port blast in a verbal message to him in recent days, a source familiar with the conversation has told CNN.

title: Two Lego blocks gave me hope in my country’s crisis
author: cnn
content: In the aftermath of a deadly explosion in Beirut in August 2020, Aya-Maria Rouhana writes that she found two Legos trampled in the dust. She’s held on to those blocks ever since because, for her, the resilience of the small toys has become a symbol of the determination of Lebanon’s next generation.

title: Top House Democrat to introduce separate bill to provide funding for Israel’s Iron Dome
author: cnn
content: House Majority Leader Steny Hoyer pledged Tuesday to bring up a separate bill to provide funding for Israel’s Iron Dome later this week after it was removed from the final House-passed bill to prevent a government shutdown and suspend the nation’s borrowing limit.

title: New Lebanon PM seeks ‘quick fixes’ to help his country out of economic crisis
author: cnn
content: New Prime Minister Najib Mikati urged Lebanon’s people to put their trust in his government as he seeks “quick fixes” to help his economically shattered country.

title: These mega projects are shaping the future of Egypt
author: cnn
content: From the country’s first high-speed rail to new cities under development, these are some of the biggest projects underway in Egypt.

title: Israel’s new plan is to ‘shrink,’ not solve, the Palestinian conflict. Here’s what that looks like
author: cnn
content: The new Israeli government that toppled long-serving Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu this summer is full of contradictions. There’s pro-peace leftists, pro-settlement right-wingers, pragmatic centrists and even for the first time an Arab Islamist party, all sitting together in one governing coalition. On the most divisive issue – the Israeli-Palestinian conflict – there is almost no consensus, which is just how Micah Goodman likes it.

title: Lebanon gets a new government, its first since last year’s deadly port blast
author: cnn
content: A new government has been formed in crisis-ridden Lebanon, ending a more than year-long power vacuum that began shortly after the August 2020 Beirut port blast.

title: Israel will reopen to small groups of tourists
author: cnn
content: Israel will allow small foreign tour groups from selected countries to visit from September 19 under a pilot program to kick-start tourism, the government said on Sunday.

title: Palestinian prisoners escape from Israeli prison, apparently through a tunnel
author: cnn
content: Israeli authorities are hunting for six Palestinian militants who broke out of prison, apparently through a tunnel, sometime early Monday morning.

title: Biden meets with new Israeli prime minister: ‘We’ve become close friends’
author: cnn
content: When Israel’s prime minister visited the White House on Friday, for the first time in 12 years it was someone other than Benjamin Netanyahu.

title: Biden looks for air-clearing in first meeting with Israel’s new leader
author: cnn
content: When Israel’s prime minister visits the White House on Thursday, for the first time in 12 years, it will be someone other than Benjamin Netanyahu.

title: At least 20 people killed when fuel tank explodes in Lebanon
author: cnn
content: At least 20 people were killed and 79 injured in a fuel tank explosion in the Akkar region in northern Lebanon, the Lebanese Red Cross said on its Twitter account early on Sunday.

title: How two mothers, united in loss, hope to bring peace in the Israeli-Palestinian conflict
author: cnn
content: “She’s like a sister for me,” Laila Alsheikh tells CNN, reflecting on colleague and friend Robi Damelin.

title: Abandoned towns offer a glimpse of Qatar’s humble past
author: cnn
content: The crumbling remains of abandoned fishing villages on the northwest coast of Qatar offer a fascinating journey into the country’s past before the oil and gas-fueled economic boom drew people away from traditional maritime ways of life.

title: A desert day trip in Qatar’s Zekreet Peninsula
author: cnn
content: Virgin beaches, ancient ruins and public art. Zekreet Peninsula, in Qatar’s northwest, is the perfect destination for a one day trip to escape the hustle and bustle of the capital Doha.

title: Israelis told to ‘stop embracing’, elderly urged to get booster as Covid-19 cases spike
author: cnn
content: Israel has urged over 60s to get their booster shots immediately and the government has tightened up coronavirus restrictions amid a fresh wave of infections.

title: A year after massive explosion in Beirut, Lebanon’s crisis deepens
author: cnn
content: Mohamad Bazzi writes that one year after the devastating Beirut explosion that killed more than 200 people and caused billions in damage, the country is worse off than it was before August 4, 2020.

title: In pictures: Huge explosion rocks Beirut
author: cnn
content: More than 200 people were killed and thousands were injured after a massive explosion in the Lebanese capital of Beirut on August 4, 2020.

title: Deadly drone attack on tanker escalates Iran-Israel maritime tensions
author: cnn
content: Maritime tensions are escalating in the Middle East following the deadly attack on a tanker connected to an Israeli billionaire in the Arabian Sea.

title: Palestinian man shot dead in violent clashes as 12-year old boy, also killed by Israeli soldiers, is buried
author: cnn
content: A Palestinian man has died after being shot by Israeli forces in the West Bank, according to the Palestinian Ministry of Health, during large clashes that broke out during the funeral of a 12-year old boy who was shot by Israeli soldiers a day earlier.

title: 12-year old Palestinian boy killed by Israeli gunfire in West Bank, Palestinian health ministry says
author: cnn
content: A 12-year old Palestinian boy has died after being shot by Israeli soldiers in the West Bank, the Palestinian Ministry of Health said.

title: Global phone hacks expose darker side of Israel’s ‘startup nation’ image
author: cnn
content: Audacious Mossad spy operations around the world. The plucky “startup nation” home to reams of billion-dollar ideas. These are two drivers of Israel’s image abroad that its political and business leaders have long been happy to push.

title: Lebanon’s water system on brink of total collapse, says UN
author: cnn
content: Lebanon’s water supply system is on the verge of total collapse, according to the United Nations Children’s Fund (UNICEF), in the latest development in the country’s slide into chaos.

title: Kosher grocery stores drop Ben & Jerry’s after its decision to stop selling ice cream in Palestinian territories
author: cnn
content: Several kosher grocery stores around the United States have decided to pull Ben & Jerry’s from their shelves after the company’s announcement this week that it would stop doing business with a licensee in Israel that sells ice cream in the Israeli-occupied Palestinian territories.

title: A fragile status quo on prayer rights at Jerusalem holy site comes under fresh strain
author: cnn
content: The scenes of Israeli forces firing stun grenades and tear gas inside Jerusalem’s Al Aqsa mosque earlier this year had a galvanizing effect on Palestinian public opinion.

title: Ben & Jerry’s will stop selling ice cream in Palestinian territories
author: cnn
content: Ben & Jerry’s will no longer sell ice cream in occupied Palestinian territories, saying it’s inconsistent with the values of the socially conscious brand.

title: Timeline: Six key moments that shaped Jerusalem
author: cnn
content: When there’s news out of Jerusalem, reports often point to recent history to explain how such a complex web of communities came to reside in the Holy City. But as historians describe in the CNN Original Series “Jerusalem: City of Faith and Fury,” the capital’s history of religious and political tension reaches far beyond the 20th century. It goes back millennia.

title: Palestinians describe fight against a West Bank settlement as an existential battle. Jewish settlers say the same
author: cnn
content: A Palestinian campaign against the settlement of Givat Evyatar had been going on for two months when settlers left. The locals call their protest Irbak al Layli, usually translated as “night confusion” – disruption techniques taken from Gaza. The Israeli army calls them violent riots.

title: Lebanon’s Gordian knot could strangle it
author: cnn
content: As Lebanon approaches its 101st birthday, there are fears that its Gordian knot could cost the tiny Mediterranean state everything.

title: Lebanon’s Hariri steps down as prime minister-designate pushing crisis-ridden country further into uncertainty
author: cnn
content: Lebanon’s Prime Minister designate Saad Hariri has stepped down nearly nine months after he was tasked with forming the crisis-ridden’s next government.

title: Lebanon is days away from a ‘social explosion,’ prime minister warns
author: cnn
content: Lebanon is days away from a “social explosion” as the country’s economic disaster worsens, caretaker Prime Minister Hassan Diab said in a meeting with ambassadors and diplomats on Tuesday, the state news agency NNA reported.

title: New Israeli government suffers first major legislative setback on controversial ‘citizenship’ law
author: cnn
content: The new Israeli government suffered its first major setback in the early hours of Tuesday morning when it failed to secure enough votes to extend a regulation that effectively bars Palestinians from the West Bank and Gaza married to Israelis from becoming citizens.

title: Demolition in East Jerusalem neighborhood heightens tensions in the city
author: cnn
content: Israeli forces have demolished a building in the East Jerusalem neighborhood of Al Bustan, the first in what locals fear could be a string of demolitions in the area.

title: Palestinians demand end to Abbas presidency after activist dies during ‘brutal beating and arrest’
author: cnn
content: Large demonstrations are being held across the West Bank calling for an end to the Palestinian Authority (PA) and the Presidency of Mahmoud Abbas, after the funeral of Palestinian activist Nizar Banat, who died while in the custody of PA security forces on Thursday morning.

title: Palestinian activist dies during ‘brutal beating and arrest’ by Palestinian Authority security forces
author: cnn
content: A well-known Palestinian critic of the Palestinian Authority (PA) has died in police custody in Hebron, sparking angry condemnation from leading figures in the West Bank and beyond.

title: Damascus to Tokyo 2020: Syrian refugees’ remarkable journeys to the Olympic Games
author: cnn
content: It has been six years since Olympian Aram Mahmoud has seen his family.

title: Palestinians cancel Pfizer vaccine agreement with Israel
author: cnn
content: The Palestinian Authority has canceled an agreement with Israel that was to have seen at least 1 million doses of the Pfizer vaccine for Covid-19 transferred to the West Bank and Gaza.

title: Israel to transfer at least 1 million Covid-19 vaccines to Palestinians in swap deal
author: cnn
content: Israel has announced plans to transfer at least one million doses of coronavirus vaccine to the Palestinian Authority (PA), according to an Israeli government statement.

title: IDF strikes Gaza for second time this week, after incendiary balloons spark eight fires in southern Israel
author: cnn
content: The Israeli military struck targets in Gaza for the second time this week, the Israel Defense Forces (IDF) said in a statement, after a continued barrage of incendiary balloons sparked eight fires in southern Israel.

title: Why balloons strapped to explosives are the latest flashpoint in Israel-Hamas tensions
author: cnn
content: Incendiary balloons are a cheap way for militant groups in Gaza to send a message to Israel, without provoking the full Israeli military retaliation that often occurs when rockets are fired from the coastal enclave.

title: Israeli military launches airstrikes in Gaza in response to incendiary balloons launched from the coastal enclave
author: cnn
content: The Israeli military struck targets in Gaza overnight Wednesday, the Israel Defense Forces (IDF) said in a statement, citing incendiary balloons launched from Gaza earlier in the day. According to reports in Israeli media, incendiary balloons launched from Gaza sparked multiple fires in southern Israel.

title: What you need to know about Israel’s new Prime Minister, Naftali Bennett
author: cnn
content: After four elections in two years, and with the country trapped in an agonizing parliamentary stalemate, Naftali Bennett appeared to be on the outside looking in, unable to reach the levers of power in Israeli politics. And yet Bennett is now Israel’s Prime Minister.

title: Controversial Jerusalem march poses first test for new Israeli government
author: cnn
content: Thousands of Israelis marched in a controversial flag-waving procession through east Jerusalem on Tuesday, risking a new round of tensions with Palestinians and posing the first test for Israel’s new government.

title: The real earthquake in Israeli politics
author: cnn
content: Anthony David writes that the inclusion of the first Arab party in an Israeli coalition government could bring permanent change to the country’s politics. If the gamble by Mansour Abbas, the Islamist leader of the United Arab List, pans out “he could be the first of many Arab power brokers in a drastically more democratic Jewish state.”

title: Netanyahu’s reign is over for now. He leaves behind a wealthier, more divided Israel and a stalled peace process
author: cnn
content: To supporters, Benjamin Netanyahu is the tireless protector of modern-day Israel who helped turn the small nation into an economic powerhouse with outsized global influence. To critics, he’s a divider who helped destroy democratic institutions while enabling the rise of extremists.

title: Israel will remain Netanyahu’s even though he is no longer prime minister
author: cnn
content: Even though Netanyahu has been pushed from office, he’ll leave his stamp on Israel for decades, writes Anshel Pfeffer. Those who expect Netanyahu’s stature and ability to dominate Israel’s agenda to be severely diminished could end up sorely disappointed. “For many Israelis, Netanyahu will remain the king-in-exile, for years to come.”

title: Israel’s new prime minister is sworn in, ending Netanyahu’s 12-year grip on power
author: cnn
content: Naftali Bennett was sworn in as Israel’s new prime minister on Sunday, after winning a confidence vote with the narrowest of margins, just 60 votes to 59. His victory ends a 12-year grip on power by former prime minister Benjamin Netanyahu, the country’s longest-serving leader.

title: Netanyahu battles to stay in power in potential last weekend as Israel’s Prime Minister
author: cnn
content: On what may turn out to be his final weekend as Prime Minister, Benjamin Netanyahu is engaged in one final fight to remain in power and extend his 12 consecutive years at Israel’s helm.

title: Omar seeks to clarify comments after Jewish House Democrats accuse her of comparing US and Israel with Hamas and Taliban
author: cnn
content: Rep. Ilhan Omar said Thursday that she was “in no way equating terrorist organizations with democratic countries” after a group of Jewish House Democrats accused her of equating the US and Israel with the Taliban and Hamas, the Palestinian militant group designated as a terrorist organization by the US.

title: Process to replace Netanyahu drags out as Israeli security chief warns violence could follow
author: cnn
content: Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu and his allies are dragging out the political process, seeking to undermine a new government set to remove him from power, as the head of the Israel Security Agency warned of incitement to violence in the charged environment.

title: Few Israelis wanted a leader to the right of Netanyahu. Naftali Bennett is set to oust his old boss anyway.
author: cnn
content: If Naftali Bennett becomes Israel’s leader, he will carry into office a history of incendiary remarks about Palestinians and a well-documented ambition to annex part of the occupied West Bank.

title: Israeli opposition parties strike coalition deal, paving the way for Netanyahu’s exit
author: cnn
content: A coalition of Israeli political parties announced Wednesday night they had agreed ​to a deal to form a new government, paving the way for the exit of Israel’s longest serving prime minister, Benjamin Netanyahu.

title: Midnight deadline approaches for Israeli coalition to unite and challenge Netanyahu
author: cnn
content: A coalition of Israeli opposition parties were approaching a midnight deadline on Wednesday to form a government, in the most serious challenge yet to Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu’s rule.

title: How boxing is changing the way society looks at women in Gaza
author: cnn
content: “I don’t like violence,” says Reema Aburahma, “I’m so girly!”

title: Is it finally the end for Benjamin Netanyahu, the great survivor of Israeli politics?
author: cnn
content: A quarter of a century ago, Israelis were stunned when Benjamin Netanyahu narrowly beat Shimon Peres to become Israel’s youngest-ever Prime Minister.

title: Benjamin Netanyahu, the longest-running Israeli prime minister, could be ousted in days after rivals agree to work on unity government
author: cnn
content: Benjamin Netanyahu’s run as the longest-serving Israeli prime minister may be coming to an end.

title: US aid group destroyed in Israeli airstrike vows to rebuild in Gaza and continue helping children
author: cnn
content: All of the progress Palestine Children’s Relief Fund made in Gaza was nearly lost last week, after its office there was destroyed in an Israeli airstrike.

title: ‘Mafias’ and ‘militias’ have brought Lebanon to its knees, activists say
author: cnn
content: Inside a tiny middle school classroom, Georgette Abushahla has crammed all of her life’s belongings. Two small sofas double as beds for her and her husband.

title: ‘Oslo’ brings the Tony-winning play about Israeli-Palestinian peace to timely life on HBO
author: cnn
content: Although “Oslo” takes place nearly 30 years ago, recent events in Israel and the Palestinian territories reflect how timely the issues at the core of this HBO movie – a stark adaptation of the Tony-winning stage play – remain. Chronicling the back-channel efforts to forge an agreement between Israelis and Palestinians, the film considers the impediments to peace, then and now, and the power of human connection as the path to achieving it.

title: What the real-life ‘Oslo’ tells us about the dream of Israeli-Palestinian peace
author: cnn
content: Aaron David Miller writes that a film version of the award-winning play “Oslo,” comes at the right time, only days after another disastrous battle between Israel and Hamas. Back when the Oslo Accords were hammered out, it was tempting to think peace was inevitable, but in the 28 years since, such hopes have been cruelly frustrated by reality.

title: Musicians, including members of The Roots and Arcade Fire, sign letter supporting Palestinians
author: cnn
content: More than 600 musicians, including members of The Roots and Arcade Fire, have issued an open letter in support of Palestinian rights.

title: Jewish House Democrats reference Greene and some progressives in concerns over uptick in anti-Semitism incidents
author: cnn
content: A group of Democratic House members who are Jewish are calling on President Joe Biden to address a rise in anti-Semitic incidents in the US amid a divide within congressional Democrats, especially between moderate and progressives, on how to address the Israeli-Palestinian conflict.

title: Israel’s political stalemate is unmoved by the conflict with Hamas
author: cnn
content: Hours before the first rockets were fired toward Jerusalem two weeks ago, the bloc of political parties trying to oust long-term Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu from power was cautiously optimistic. The group, led by former TV anchor Yair Lapid of the centrist Yesh Atid party, would be able to form a government within a week or two, or so they thought.

title: Let this be the last Israel-Gaza ceasefire
author: cnn
content: A strong and lasting peace in the Middle East may seem far off given the recent heightened tensions in the West Bank, including Jerusalem, and Gaza, but that should still be the goal for the US, Egypt and, most importantly, Israelis and the Palestinians, writes Motaz Zahran, Ambassador of Egypt to the United States.

title: US will make ‘significant contributions’ to rebuilding Gaza, Blinken says
author: cnn
content: The United States will make “significant contributions” to rebuild Gaza and reopen its consulate in Jerusalem following the recent conflict between Israel and Hamas, US Secretary of State Antony Blinken said on the first day of his first official visit to the region.

title: Young Jewish Americans rocked by new hate fueled by Israel-Palestinian conflict
author: cnn
content: In New York, some Gen Z Jews are surprised and angry at anti-Semitic attacks they’re seeing on the streets and online, and wondering where their supporters are.

title: Biden and Harris condemn recent attacks on Jewish community in US and abroad
author: cnn
content: President Joe Biden and Vice President Kamala Harris on Monday condemned recent attacks toward the Jewish community after several Jewish people were targeted in cities across the US and abroad as tensions flare over the Israeli-Palestinian conflict.

title: Two stabbed near Jerusalem’s Sheikh Jarrah neighborhood, attacker shot and killed
author: cnn
content: An attacker stabbed two men near Jerusalem’s Sheikh Jarrah neighborhood on Monday, according to Israeli police, wounding them before being shot and killed by police officers.

title: Blinken: ‘There has to be’ a prospect for a peaceful political solution between Israel and Palestinians
author: cnn
content: Secretary of State Antony Blinken insisted Sunday that there will eventually be a prospect for a peaceful political solution between Israel and the Palestinians, saying one must come following a “critical” ceasefire declared in the region last week.

title: A truce halted the bloodshed, but the frustration of young Palestinians is stronger than ever
author: cnn
content: After the declaration of a ceasefire brought an end to more than 10 days of conflict between Gaza and Israel, Palestinians can rest a little easier. But they say their day-to-day reality hasn’t changed.

title: Supporters of Palestinian rights hold protests across the United States
author: cnn
content: Protesters rallied in cities across the United States on Saturday in support of Palestinians, days after Israel and Hamas agreed to a ceasefire ending the latest round of violence and bloodshed in a decades-long conflict.

title: Pakistan’s top diplomat makes anti-Semitic remark during CNN interview about Gaza conflict
author: cnn
content: In a CNN interview that was supposed to focus on the United Nations finding a solution to the violence between Israel and Hamas, Pakistan’s top diplomat Shah Mahmood Qureshi instead made an anti-Semitic remark.

title: Gaza mourns its dead as the specter of an endless cycle of conflict looms
author: cnn
content: It’s over. The bombs and rockets no longer fall; on Friday night families in Gaza City ventured out to stroll around the main square, or sit on the benches.

title: Biden’s ‘quiet’ answer to a foreign policy test
author: cnn
content: President Joe Biden’s foreign policy doctrine came into sharper relief this week as tensions came to a boil between Israel and Hamas in Gaza.

title: Anti-Semitic attacks are being reported in US cities as tensions flare over the Israeli-Palestinian conflict
author: cnn
content: Several Jewish people have been attacked in cities across the United States this week.

title: Israeli forces in violent confrontations with Palestinians outside Jerusalem’s Al Aqsa mosque after Gaza ceasefire
author: cnn
content: Israeli security forces used stun grenades and rubber bullets against Palestinians outside the Al Aqsa mosque in Jerusalem, where thousands of worshipers had been attending Friday prayers, puncturing a half-day of calm brought on by a ceasefire between Israel and Hamas.

title: In pictures: Israelis and Palestinians endure days of violence
author: cnn
content: Israel and the Palestinian militant group Hamas have agreed to a ceasefire after one of the area’s worst rounds of violence since the 2014 Gaza War.

title: The Israeli-Palestinian conflict has strained medical services and left families reeling. Here are six organizations you can support to help victims
author: cnn
content: As the status of the Israeli-Palestinian conflict remains uncertain, families in the region continue to reel.

title: Israel and Palestinian militant group Hamas agree to a ceasefire
author: cnn

title: New hopes of ceasefire deal as calls to end Israel-Palestinian conflict intensify
author: cnn
content: Cautious optimism was growing that a ceasefire between Israel and Palestinian militants in Gaza could soon put a halt to days of bloody conflict, but fresh airstrikes and rocket fire Thursday signaled that the violence wasn’t over yet.

title: Airstrikes turned Gaza’s schools into shelters. Officials fear Covid-19 may turn them into super-spreader centers
author: cnn
content: Rasha Abu Askar and her husband tested positive for Covid-19, leaving them unable to look after their four children, a situation many parents have dreaded during the pandemic. But this couple live in Gaza, and their problems are bigger than childcare arrangements.

title: The Trump-Netanyahu bromance deepened American Jews’ divide on Israel
author: cnn
content: Samuel G. Freedman writes that by turning Israel into a partisan wedge issue, and alienating many American Jews in the process, former President Donald Trump and Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu ensured that when the time came for Israel to need bipartisan support and a united front of American Jews neither would be readily available anymore.

title: Sanders will introduce resolution disapproving $735 million US arms sale to Israel
author: cnn
content: Independent Sen. Bernie Sanders will introduce a resolution on Thursday disapproving of the US sale of $735 million in precision-guided weapons to Israel, according to a draft obtained by CNN.

title: Hamas predicts Mideast ceasefire is ‘imminent’ amid growing global pressure
author: cnn
content: A ceasefire in the bloody Israeli-Palestinian conflict could be “imminent, possibly within 24 hours,” Hamas officials told CNN Wednesday, as world leaders dialed up pressure on both sides to end the fighting. Israel, however, has not commented on the possibility of a ceasefire deal.

title: Why the United Nations is stuck on the Israeli-Palestinian conflict
author: cnn
content: The deadly ongoing Israeli-Palestinian conflict is the kind of challenge you might think the United Nations could address. After all, it played a major role in establishing Israel as a state more than 70 years ago, what Palestinians refer to as the Nakba or “catastrophe.” But it’s not doing much on this one.

title: Israeli jets pound Gaza as rocket fire resumes and Palestinians hit streets to protest
author: cnn
content: Israeli warplanes continued to pound Gaza on Tuesday and rocket fire into Israel resumed after a brief lull, as Palestinian protesters hit the streets in cities across the West Bank and elsewhere.

title: Biden mostly sticks to touting green energy and infrastructure during trip complicated by Middle East violence
author: cnn
content: President Joe Biden used his Tuesday visit to the critical battleground state of Michigan to tout his green energy and infrastructure plans, and largely shied away from weighing in on the recent eruption of violence in the Middle East.

title: Israel’s Iron Dome doesn’t chase every rocket it sees
author: cnn
content: Over the last nine days, thousands of rockets have been fired from Gaza towards Israeli territory. And every day they’ve been met by missiles from Israel’s Iron Dome defense system.

title: Rift grows within Democratic Party over Israeli-Palestinian conflict as violence intensifies
author: cnn
content: A number of congressional Democrats are ramping up pressure on the Biden administration to more forcefully engage on the Israeli-Palestinian conflict as violence in the region intensifies, revealing a delicate shift in the way Democrats have talked about Israel for decades and a small crack in the party on foreign policy.

title: Biden administration notified Congress of $735 million weapons sale to Israel earlier this month, before violence began
author: cnn
content: The Biden administration notified Congress of a proposed US weapons sale to Israel worth $735 million earlier this month, according to two sources familiar with the notification.

title: Biden ‘expressed his support for a ceasefire’ in call with Israeli Prime Minister, White House says
author: cnn
content: President Joe Biden voiced support for a ceasefire Monday as intensifying violence between Israel and Hamas militants in Gaza entered a second week.

title: People across the US join pro-Palestinian protests
author: cnn
content: Thousands gathered in major cities across the United States over the weekend to support Palestinians as Israel’s military launches massive airstrikes on Gaza and the death toll mounts.

title: Netanyahu vows to continue strikes on Gaza as Israel pounds Hamas targets
author: cnn
content: The Israeli military pounded Gaza with airstrikes on Monday, saying it was targeting the homes and infrastructure of the Palestinian militant group Hamas, as Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu vowed “to continue to strike at the targets of terrorism.”

title: Bella Hadid joined pro-Palestinian protests
author: cnn
content: Bella Hadid made it clear this weekend where her support lies when it comes to the Israeli-Palestinian conflict.

title: More than 25 Democratic senators call for immediate ceasefire in Middle East
author: cnn
content: More than 25 Democratic senators, led by Georgia Sen. Jon Ossoff, released a joint statement calling for an immediate ceasefire agreement in Israel and the Palestinian territories to “prevent further loss of life and further escalation of violence.”

title: Israel-Palestinian conflict marks its deadliest day as scenes of horror unfold in Gaza
author: cnn
content: Israel bombed the house of Hamas’ Gaza leader and obliterated a family’s home in Gaza as Hamas launched more than 100 rockets towards Israel on Sunday.

title: Palestinians deserve the same security, equality and right to a homeland as the Israelis
author: cnn
content: Dean Obeidallah writes that the days of denying the humanity of Palestinians must end. If history serves as a guide, the conflict will slowly fade from the headlines after a ceasefire is reached “and the Palestinians will largely be forgotten—yet again. For those who sincerely want to see a just and lasting peace in the Middle East, this time must be different.”

title: Israeli emergency services responding to a synagogue bleacher collapse described as a ‘mass casualty event’
author: cnn
content: Israeli emergency services are responding to what they have described as a “mass casualty event” after bleachers collapsed at an Orthodox synagogue in the West Bank settlement of Giv’at Ze’ev northwest of Jerusalem.

title: Media offices destroyed by Israeli airstrike in Gaza
author: cnn
content: The Associated Press, Al Jazeera, and media advocacy groups are demanding answers after an Israeli airstrike destroyed a building with offices belonging to news outlets in Gaza on Saturday.

title: The latest violence between Israel and Palestinians will end when both sides can declare victory. But it will be no more than a truce
author: cnn
content: The current explosion of violence between Palestinians and the state of Israel is yet to inflict as many casualties as the devastating 2014 Gaza conflict, but in many ways is a bleaker and more foreboding episode. Confrontation is not confined to aerial bombardment and rocket fire over Gaza and southern Israel but has spread to the streets of Israeli towns, to neighborhoods of Jerusalem and across the West Bank.

title: Tensions between Israel and Palestinians are sky-high. Here’s what you need to know
author: cnn
content: Conflict between Israelis and Palestinians boiled over this week, escalating rapidly into one of the worst rounds of violence between the two sides in the last several years.

title: Biden faces an angry rift in his own party over Israeli-Palestinian conflict
author: cnn
content: Democrats have their own brewing disagreement over how the US should react to violence between Israelis and Palestinians. It’s an awkward public fight for a party that has made its commitment to social and racial justice a main part of its platform.

title: Israeli strikes hit home in Gaza refugee camp, media offices as conflict intensifies
author: cnn
content: Israel bombed a house in Gaza where a family had gathered to celebrate the end of Ramadan and an office housing international media as a new flurry of Hamas missiles rained down on Tel Aviv Saturday, increasing fears that a de-escalation of the conflict could soon be out of reach.

title: At least 10 Palestinians killed by Israeli soldiers in violent confrontations in West Bank, as Gaza rocket fire enters fifth day
author: cnn
content: At least 10 Palestinians were killed Friday by Israeli forces during violent clashes in towns and cities across the West Bank, the Gaza-based Palestinian Health Ministry said in a statement, as sirens continued to blare all day across southern Israel, indicating another day of ceaseless rocket fire from Gaza.

title: Whatever happened to Jared Kushner’s peace plan?
author: cnn
content: David A. Andelman writes that the escalation of tensions between Israelis and Palestinians this week raises the question of if the peace plan that former President Donald Trump’s son-in-law Jared Kushner and Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu brokered over a year ago has actually worked.

title: Israel launches more strikes on Gaza as fears of a ground invasion grow
author: cnn
content: The Israeli military directed heavy artillery fire and dozens of airstrikes into Gaza overnight into Friday, as fears grew that a ground invasion of the territory could be launched to quell rocket fire from Palestinian militants.

title: A NYC mosque was vandalized with anti-Palestinian graffiti
author: cnn
content: New York City police are searching for the person who vandalized a mosque in Brooklyn with anti-Palestinian graffiti on one of the holiest days in the Muslim faith.
