title: Terrified families huddle together in Gaza as Eid festivities turn into nights of death and destruction
author: cnn
content: The family of 30-year-old journalist Reema Saad gathered to sleep in a single room on Wednesday night, as many Palestinian families said they had done to give each other comfort and solace on nights of heavy Israeli bombardment in Gaza.

title: White House not bending to pressure from progressives to condemn Israel
author: cnn
content: President Joe Biden and the White House are showing little willingness to bend to pressure from liberal Democrats calling for more robust condemnation of Israel’s actions amid the worst regional violence in years.

title: Heavy artillery fire on Gaza escalates violence as clashes between Arabs and Jews rock Israeli cities
author: cnn
content: Gaza came under heavy artillery fire early Friday morning, amid reports – later conclusively denied – that the Israeli army had launched a possible ground invasion of the Strip.

title: Global airlines cancel flights to Israel as violence escalates
author: cnn
content: Global airlines are canceling flights to Israel as clashes between the country’s military and Palestinian militants in Gaza intensify.

title: The explosion of Israeli-Palestinian violence poses a test for Biden
author: cnn
content: “Just when I thought I was out, they pull me back in.”

title: Netanyahu warns against ‘lynchings’ as clashes between Arabs and Jews rock Israeli cities
author: cnn
content: As the Israeli military and Palestinian militants in Gaza exchange deadly airstrikes and rocket bombardments, rioting and violent clashes have also swept through several Israeli cities between Arab and Jewish citizens.

title: Biden speaks with Netanyahu as Israeli and Palestinian violence pulls US focus back to Middle East
author: cnn
content: Entering office, President Joe Biden hoped to shift US foreign policy away from the Middle East and toward areas he thought of as more modern-day threats: China, Russia and cyberspace.

title: 67 killed in Gaza, 7 killed in Israel as UN warns conflict could turn into ‘full-scale war’
author: cnn
content: The worst violence in years between Israelis and Palestinians showed no signs of letting up Wednesday, as continued Israeli airstrikes and Hamas rocket fire prompted the United Nations to warn the conflict could mushroom into “full-scale war.”

title: Hell has been unleashed in Gaza
author: cnn
content: Since Monday evening, Israel’s aerial operation has left more than 60 Gazans dead, militants among them, but more civilians, according to figures from the Gaza-based Palestinian health ministry. More than a dozen of were children. Additionally, more than 365 others have been injured in the fighting, the ministry said. The Israeli military said at least 15 of the deaths were Hamas militants.

title: Battle between Israel and Hamas is an unwelcome surprise for Biden
author: cnn
content: Aaron David Miller and Daniel Kurtzer write that the Biden administration must do everything it can to defuse the latest crisis to erupt between Israelis and Palestinians. This will require a multipronged diplomatic effort that is based on a clear division of labor – the US speaking to Israel, and America’s Arab and European partners negotiating with Hamas and the Palestinian Authority.

title: Mo Salah’s ‘killing of innocent people’ tweet prompts comments on what he doesn’t say
author: cnn
content: It’s a tweet that’s received 265,000 likes, been retweeted more than 88,000 times and prompted almost 12,000 comments.

title: Israel holds all the cards in Jerusalem, yet the city has never been more divided
author: cnn
content: “Marhaba” – hello in Arabic – began the brief text the middle-aged Jerusalem housewife found on her cell phone Monday evening. “You have been identified participating in violent acts at Al Aqsa mosque. You will be held accountable. Israeli Intelligence.”

title: At least 35 killed in Gaza as Israel ramps up airstrikes in response to rocket attacks
author: cnn
content: Tensions between Israel and Palestinians escalated further on Tuesday as Palestinian militants in Gaza fired hundreds of rockets into Israel, which in turn ramped up airstrikes on the coastal enclave, as unrest spread to cities and towns beyond Jerusalem.

title: Israel launches airstrikes after rockets fired from Gaza in day of escalation
author: cnn
content: Israel and Palestinian militants in Gaza have been exchanging fire through the night after clashes in Jerusalem Monday left hundreds injured and tensions sky high, prompting an uptick in the violence, official sources and pictures showed.

title: Israeli Supreme Court delays hearing on Palestinian evictions from East Jerusalem neighborhood
author: cnn
content: Israel’s Supreme Court on Sunday postponed a hearing on the possible eviction of several Palestinian families from their homes in Jerusalem and will set a new date within 30 days.

title: At least 100 injured in 2nd night of clashes between Israeli police and Palestinians in Jerusalem, Palestinian Red Crescent says
author: cnn
content: At least 100 people were injured as Palestinians and Israeli police clashed in Jerusalem for a second night Saturday, according to the Palestinian Red Crescent.

title: Yair Lapid gets mandate to try to form next Israeli government
author: cnn
content: Centrist lawmaker Yair Lapid has been tasked with trying to form a new government in Israel, after longtime Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu was forced to admit failure in his efforts to reach agreement with potential coalition allies on Tuesday night.

title: Deadline looms for Netanyahu to build new government in Israel
author: cnn
content: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu has one more day to convince potential partners to join him in a new government, or risk seeing the country’s President hand the opportunity to a rival.

title: For a grieving Israel, a joyous holiday will forever be tainted
author: cnn
content: Israel’s grief over the Mount Meron tragedy is compounded by the fact that it happened on Lag B’Omer, a festival that commemorates the mysterious plague that killed some 24,000 students in the second century CE, writes Ilanit Chernick. Friday’s gathering had special resonance because it also symbolized the celebration of Israel’s re-emergence from another devastating plague – coronavirus.

title: As families bury their dead, recriminations begin over deadly crush at a religious festival in Israel
author: cnn
content: As the Shabbat drew to a close in Israel, funerals for the victims of Friday’s crush at Mount Meron have resumed – and so have the recriminations over the mountaintop disaster that killed 45 people, including children.

title: Crush at religious festival in Israel’s Mount Meron kills 45 people
author: cnn
content: Israeli investigators are examining what caused a crush that killed at least 44 worshipers and injured 100 more at a mass religious gathering in Mount Meron overnight.

title: Israel religious festival crush kills 45
author: cnn
content: At least 45 worshipers died in a crush during a mass religious gathering at Israel’s Mount Meron overnight. Get the latest updates here.

title: Abbas postpones Palestinian elections, blaming Israel over East Jerusalem impasse
author: cnn
content: Palestinian Authority President Mahmoud Abbas has announced the postponement of planned parliamentary elections, saying Israel has failed to confirm it will allow voting in East Jerusalem.

title: Archaeologists uncover 1,600-year-old mosaic in Israel
author: cnn
content: A well-preserved 1,600-year-old mosaic has been unearthed by archaeologists working in the Israeli city of Yavne.

title: Lebanon battles swarms of locusts after wind changes direction
author: cnn
content: Army helicopters are spraying agricultural land in northeast Lebanon to help farmers battle swarms of locusts that flew to the country in what a United Nations agency said was a “very rare” event caused by a change in the wind direction.

title: Israel accused of apartheid by Human Rights Watch
author: cnn
content: Human Rights Watch has accused the Israeli government of committing crimes of apartheid and persecution against Palestinians in a new report Tuesday, eliciting an angry response from Israeli officials.

title: Dozens of Palestinians injured in police clashes as Jewish extremists chanting ‘Death to Arabs’ march in Jerusalem
author: cnn
content: Clashes between Palestinians from east Jerusalem and Israeli police around the Damascus gate entrance to the Old City erupted in a night of unrest that earlier saw Jewish extremists marching through another city street shouting “Death to Arabs.”

title: In a fabled desert city, a decisive battle could determine Yemen’s fate
author: cnn
content: Marib is a tiny island of hope in a sea of discarded dreams. After six years of war, the city of more than 2 million people has emerged as pivotal in Yemen’s future.

title: As Covid-19 surges globally, Israel is emerging into post-pandemic life
author: cnn
content: Masks are no longer required outdoors. The economy is open. It’s difficult to get a reservation at many restaurants. Students are back in school full time. Live theater and sports are back on.

title: Darfur’s return to war would spell disaster for Sudan
author: cnn
content: At least 125 people were killed this month when Arab and Masalit tribesmen fought running street battles in the Sudanese city of El Geneina. Norwegian Refugee Council Secretary-General Jan Egeland warns this new violence must be addressed.

title: Mysterious blackout in Iran threatens to undermine nuclear talks
author: cnn
content: Iran’s Foreign Minister Javad Zarif has vowed revenge against Israel after an apparent attack on an Iranian nuclear site caused a blackout at the facility over the weekend.

title: Israeli army chief appears to hint at possible role in Iran nuclear site incident
author: cnn
content: Israel’s army chief has appeared to hint at possible Israeli involvement in an incident at the Natanz nuclear site in Iran, which was described as “terrorist action” by the head of Iran’s atomic energy agency.

title: Roger Waters and Tom Morello to perform in an online benefit concert for Palestinian musicians in Gaza
author: cnn
content: Roger Waters, Tom Morello and Brian Eno will join a host of Palestinian musicians on Saturday for an online benefit concert dubbed, “Live for Gaza.”

title: US reinstates hundreds of millions in funding to Palestinians, reversing Trump decision
author: cnn
content: The US will resume the flow of hundreds of millions of dollars in aid for Palestinians that was previously halted by the Trump administration.

title: More than 50 dead as rival groups clash in Sudan’s West Darfur, medics say
author: cnn
content: Clashes between rival groups have claimed more than 50 lives in the city of El Geneina in the volatile west Darfur region of Sudan, according to Sudanese medical groups.

title: Israel’s election aftermath: The good, the bad and the ugly
author: cnn
content: The good, the bad and the ugly. Aaron David Miller writes that Israel’s fourth election in a little over two years may look like a repeat of the last three on the surface, the results reveal a trend that may have long term consequences in Israeli politics.

title: In a jarring day for Israel, Netanyahu’s corruption trial resumes as coalition talks heat up
author: cnn
content: Benjamin Netanyahu faced some of his biggest challenges to date, both legally and politically, in a historic split-screen day in Israel.

title: Egypt’s unreal ‘snowy’ mountains become a tourist hit
author: cnn
content: Images of people frolicking in apparently snowy landscapes and sliding down what looks like icy mountains have created an unlikely tourism attraction in Egypt. But all is not as it seems – the scenery is made of salt.

title: US to resume diplomatic ties with Palestinians that were cut under Trump
author: cnn
content: The US will resume diplomatic ties with Palestinians that were cut under the Trump administration, the US ambassador to the United Nations, Linda Thomas-Greenfield, told the Security Council Thursday.

title: Jordan police detain scores of activists, break up protests
author: cnn
content: Jordanian riot police on Wednesday broke up protests in Amman and other cities called to mark the 10th anniversary of Arab Spring pro-democracy demonstrations, and authorities detained tens of activists, witnesses said.

title: Israel election exit polls point to stalemate for Netanyahu
author: cnn
content: Benjamin Netanyahu has thanked the voters of Israel for making his Likud the largest party after the country’s fourth election in two years but exit poll projections by the three main Israeli TV networks all point increasingly towards a period of renewed political deadlock.

title: Saudi-led coalition intensifies Yemen air strikes, hits grains port
author: cnn
content: The Saudi-led coalition fighting in Yemen unleashed dozens of air strikes against what it called Houthi military targets in the country’s north, including the capital Sanaa and the port of Salif on the Red Sea coast.

title: Specter of civil conflict in Lebanon looms as economic meltdown gives way to violence
author: cnn
content: Fistfights break out in supermarkets nearly every day daily. Long lines snake out of the few open gas stations. Pharmacies have threatened to close. Gunfights inexplicably erupt in various parts of Beirut. And the situation could soon get worse.

title: Emiratis accuse Netanyahu of exploiting normalization deal for election gain
author: cnn
content: The United Arab Emirates has publicly distanced itself from Benjamin Netanyahu over concerns the Israeli Prime Minister was using Abu Dhabi to boost his prospects in upcoming Israeli elections.

title: Egypt jails activist who called to free prisoners amid pandemic
author: cnn
content: An Egyptian court sentenced prominent female activist Sanaa Seif to a year and a half in prison on Wednesday for spreading false news, her sister and judicial sources said.

title: Israel vaccination ‘green pass’ may offer a glimpse of a post-Covid future
author: cnn
content: While the rest of the world debates how a Covid vaccination passport will work, Israel has introduced one that is already opening restaurants, bars and events and offering a sense of normality that may soon be replicated elsewhere.

title: ICC prosecutor to launch formal investigation into alleged war crimes in Palestinian territories
author: cnn
content: The chief prosecutor at the International Criminal Court (ICC) has announced plans for a formal investigation into alleged war crimes by Israel in the Palestinian territories.

title: Houthis say they’ve seized majority control of key city in Yemen
author: cnn
content: Yemen’s Houthi rebels have taken control of 10 out of 14 districts of the strategic northern city of Marib, the Houthi deputy foreign minister, Hussein al-Ezzi, told CNN Wednesday.

title: Oil spill leads Israel to close beaches as it faces one of its ‘most severe ecological disasters’
author: cnn
content: Israeli authorities are trying to locate the source of a suspected oil spill that has been described as one of the most severe ecological disasters to hit the country, threatening wildlife, forcing beaches to close and prompting a mass cleanup.

title: Netanyahu, long a supporter of LGBTQ rights, courts homophobes and racists in bid to cling to power
author: cnn
content: In the past, Benjamin Netanyahu has championed LGBTQ rights. His party’s Knesset members have also walked out of the chamber when racist politicians on the extreme right have taken the floor. Not, it seems, anymore.

title: An American family stuck in Gaza for months due to Covid restrictions finally leaves: ‘It was hell’
author: cnn
content: An American family visiting Gaza say they were left “stranded in a hellish situation” for months due to the coronavirus pandemic and a blockade surrounding the Palestinian territory.

title: Biden is hitting the reset button with Israel
author: cnn
content: Aaron David Miller writes that President Joe Biden’s delay in calling Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu is surely a calculated effort to demonstrate that there will be no return to the Israel-centric policies of the Donald Trump years. And while Israel will remain America’s closest ally in the Middle East, Biden is planning a reset.

title: US files complaint with Israel over unfair airline treatment for Tel Aviv flights
author: cnn
content: The US Department of Transportation has filed a complaint with Israel over unfair treatment of airlines, stemming from the closure of Ben Gurion International Airport in which Israel has allowed the country’s El Al airline to fly passengers but barred US airlines from doing the same, an Israeli official with knowledge of the complaint confirmed to CNN.

title: Diplomats condemn Netanyahu’s settlement drive after Israeli troops destroy Bedouin camp three times in a month
author: cnn
content: The extended families of about 100 people, semi-nomadic Bedouin shepherds laying ancient claim to the grazing and fecund fields around them, say they watched as the Israeli army destroyed their tents and animal pens three times in the last month.

title: Egypt builds concrete security wall to protect popular Red Sea beach resort
author: cnn
content: Egypt says a recently constructed 36-kilometer concrete and wire barrier encircling Sharm el-Sheikh will help protect tourism at the Red Sea resort on the southern tip of the Sinai peninsula.

title: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu pleads not guilty to corruption charges
author: cnn
content: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu has told a Jerusalem court he is not guilty of one charge of bribery and three charges of fraud and breach of trust.

title: Israel’s risky rhetoric on Iran
author: cnn
content: Aaron David Miller and Richard Sokolsky write that recent warnings by the chief of staff of  the Israel Defense Forces suggest that Israel may be beating the war drums for a military strike against Iran as the Biden administration tries to reengage Tehran on its nuclear program.

title: Small blast goes off near Israeli embassy in New Delhi
author: cnn
content: A small blast went off close to the Israeli embassy in the Indian capital of New Delhi on Friday afternoon, damaging the windows of parked vehicles.

title: Violence and slurs from some of Israel’s ultra-Orthodox Jews in battle over coronavirus lockdowns
author: cnn
content: Some of Israel’s ultra-Orthodox Jews are resorting to violence and extreme slurs in a battle over coronavirus restrictions.

title: Facebook suspends Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu-linked chatbot for breaking its privacy rules
author: cnn
content: Facebook has deleted a post by Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu and suspended a chatbot linked to his account for violating the company’s privacy policy.

title: Vaccination rates highlight stark differences between Israelis and Palestinians – amid row over responsibility
author: cnn
content: Two young men work side-by-side in a butcher’s shop. They live in the same teeming and densely packed town. One is fortunate – he’s eligible to get an Israeli Covid-19 vaccination. The other isn’t.

title: Israel isn’t a democracy, it’s an ‘apartheid regime,’ rights group says
author: cnn
content: Israel is no longer a democracy but an “apartheid regime” devoted to cementing the supremacy of Jews over Palestinians, the country’s best-known human rights group said in a report published Tuesday.

title: Arab countries agree to end years-long feud with Qatar that divided Gulf
author: cnn
content: Gulf Arab countries signed a declaration aimed at resolving a long-running dispute with Qatar on Tuesday, in a public reconciliation between Doha and its neighbors that paves the way for the end of an embargo on the tiny gas-rich nation.

title: Israeli soldier shoots and paralyzes Palestinian man in dispute over power generator
author: cnn
content: An Israeli soldier shot a Palestinian man, leaving him paralyzed from the neck down, after an altercation over a portable electric generator, according to the Palestinian Ministry of Health.

title: Jonathan Pollard, spy who passed US secrets to Israel, arrives in Jewish state to start new life
author: cnn
content: Convicted spy Jonathan Pollard arrived in Israel from the United States on Wednesday, more than three decades after he was jailed for passing secrets to the state.

title: Top Palestinian DJ detained as party at Muslim holy site sparks angry scenes and scapegoating claims
author: cnn
content: A leading female Palestinian DJ has been remanded in custody for 15 days after she was arrested by Palestinian Authority (PA) security forces for performing at a party at a Muslim holy site, leading to claims of official over-reaction to an event that sparked furious scenes over the weekend.

title: Lebanon’s caretaker Prime Minister calls Beirut port explosion ‘suspicious’
author: cnn
content: A probe into hundreds of tons of ammonium nitrate left at Beirut’s port began just hours before a massive blast rocked the site, leaving more than 200 dead and devastating the Lebanese capital, caretaker Prime Minister Hassan Diab told CNN on Tuesday.

title: Israel’s government collapses, not with a bang but a whimper, triggering fourth election in 2 years
author: cnn
content: The Israeli government collapsed on Tuesday at midnight (17.00 EST) local time after the country’s parliament failed to meet a deadline for passage of the 2020 and 2021 budgets. Israel will now head to its fourth elections in two years, probably on March 23 next year.

title: Trump announces Israel and Morocco to normalize relations
author: cnn
content: Morocco has become the fourth country in the Middle East and North African region to agree to establish full diplomatic relations with Israel, an 11th-hour foreign policy achievement for the lame duck Trump administration as it seeks to shore up regional support for Israel as a countermeasure to Iranian aggression.

title: Lebanon’s prime minister charged over deadly Beirut blast
author: cnn
content: A Lebanese judge has charged caretaker Prime Minister Hassan Diab and three ex-ministers with criminal neglect over the huge explosion at Beirut’s port that killed more than 200 people this summer.

title: The UAE and Israel’s whirlwind honeymoon has gone beyond normalization
author: cnn
content: Never has the process of normalization been so fast, and pursued with such mutual enthusiasm, as between Israel and the UAE, Ben Wedeman writes.

title: US official says Israel was behind assassination of Iranian scientist
author: cnn
content: A senior US administration official said Israel was behind the assassination of Iran’s top nuclear scientist but declined to give details about whether the Trump administration knew about the attack before it was carried out or provided support.

title: Israel strikes targets in Syria after discovery of IEDs in Golan Heights
author: cnn
content: Israel’s military carried out a series of strikes on targets in Syria early Wednesday morning, including a site at the Damascus International Airport used as Iranian headquarters, following the discovery of improvised explosive devices planted in the Golan Heights, according to the Israel Defense Forces.

title: Pentagon senior adviser accused Pompeo and senior politicians of taking money and getting rich from ‘the Israeli lobby’
author: cnn
content: A new senior adviser at the Pentagon repeatedly said the United States’ support for Israel was the result of “Israeli lobby” money and accused prominent officials, including Secretary of State Mike Pompeo, of becoming “very very rich,” from their support for Israel.

title: Palestinian prisoner ends hunger strike after making deal with Israeli authorities
author: cnn
content: A Palestinian detainee held by Israel has ended a hunger strike lasting more than 100 days, after Israeli authorities agreed he would be freed at the end of the month and his administrative detention order would not be renewed, according to the Palestinian Prisoners Club, a Ramallah-based non-governmental organization that looks after the interests of Palestinian prisoners held in Israeli jails.

title: UN and EU slam Israel after West Bank demolition leaves 73 Palestinians homeless
author: cnn
content: The United Nations and the European Union have criticized the demolition by the Israeli military of a large portion of a Palestinian community in the West Bank that left 73 people, including 41 children, homeless.

title: The wonders of Saqqara, Egypt
author: cnn
content: Incredible ancient artifacts continue to be discovered at the necropolis and UNESCO World Heritage Site south of Cairo.

title: Trump announces that Israel and Sudan have agreed to normalize relations
author: cnn
content: President Donald Trump announced Friday that Sudan and Israel have agreed to normalize relations – a foreign policy achievement for the incumbent president less than two weeks before the US presidential election.

title: Israelis can now travel to Dubai. The Persian Gulf will never be the same
author: cnn
content: For decades, Israelis couldn’t travel to the UAE and its dazzling city of Dubai – or vice versa. That’s all changed with new diplomatic relations. Find out what residents of Israel and Dubai hope to see once the pandemic eases.

title: Lebanon’s uprising never wanted power. Then a blast ripped through Beirut and everything changed
author: cnn
content: A 360-degree turn in Lebanon’s political mood has prompted activists to organize into political parties and alliances.

title: The approach of the US elections helps push Lebanon and Iraq to the brink
author: cnn
content: Tensions in Iraq and Lebanon are reaching fever pitch as the US elections draw near and raise the stakes in the Middle East’s geopolitical battlegrounds.

title: The UAE and Bahrain deals: normalizing the abnormal
author: cnn
content: The agreements between the United Arab Emirates (UAE) and Bahrain on the one hand and Israel on the other, brokered by the Trump administration and signed at the White House on Sept. 15, attempted to normalize the abnormal in spite of their misleading declarations about realizing peace.

title: Lebanon’s PM-designate, named as part of French initiative to save the country, steps down
author: cnn
content: Lebanon’s PM-designate Mustapha Adib, who was set to take the helm of a rescue government, has stepped down after failing to break a political stalemate over the cabinet formation.

title: Israel is winning on the world stage, but losing the plot at home
author: cnn
content: Last week’s signing ceremony on the south lawn of the White House was the celebration Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu wanted – and the distraction he needed from mounting problems at home.

title: Notorious for the anti-Arab racism of some of its fans, Israeli soccer club explores Emirati investment
author: cnn
content: A glass cabinet in the lobby of Moshe Hogeg’s office is filled with action hero figures. The high-tech executive explained to CNN’s Oren Liebermann why Batman was his favorite: “He doesn’t really have superpowers whatsoever but it makes you feel like maybe you can do big things also.”

title: In political turmoil and economic collapse, Lebanon could now be overwhelmed by Covid-19
author: cnn
content: Coronavirus cases have skyrocketed in Lebanon, where the crisis-ridden state is considering new lockdown measures, raising the specter of a deepening financial crunch.

title: Middle East agreements brokered by Trump present opportunity for Biden if he wins election
author: cnn
content: The moment the pens went to paper to sign the Abraham Accords, normalizing relations between two Sunni-led Gulf Arab nations and the Jewish State while the Palestinians seethed off stage, Joe Biden must have pumped his fist in triumph.

title: Two Gulf nations recognized Israel at the White House. Here’s what’s in it for all sides
author: cnn
content: President Trump and Israel’s Benjamin Netanyahu will join the UAE and Bahrain officials at the White House to mark historic normalization agreements between Israel and the two Arab countries. Here’s what you need to know.

title: READ: Full text of the Abraham Accords and agreements between Israel and the United Arab Emirates/Bahrain
author: cnn
content: President Donald Trump and Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu on Tuesday joined the foreign ministers of the United Arab Emirates and Bahrain at the White House to mark historic normalization agreements between Israel and the two Arab countries.

title: A huge step toward end of Arab-Israeli conflict
author: cnn
content: Michael Oren writes that the normalization between Israel and the UAE and Bahrain, as between Israel and other Arab states, can be a rare source of stability. The task now is to build on that progress and ensure a more secure future for both the Middle East and America.

title: Israel is going into a second nationwide lockdown over Covid-19
author: cnn
content: Israel has approved a second general lockdown as coronavirus cases surge across the country. The lockdown, which is expected to start Friday afternoon, will see the country return to many of the same severe restrictions of the first lockdown back in April.

title: Ending the Iranian occupation
author: cnn
content: Arabs have more in common with Israel than many realize, writes Jason Greenblatt, the former US Middle East envoy under President Trump: The entire region suffers under Iran’s sprawling influence and consistent threats to stability and security.

title: Israel and the Kingdom of Bahrain to establish ‘full diplomatic relations,’ Trump says
author: cnn
content: President Donald Trump said Friday that Israel and Bahrain have agreed to the “establishment of full diplomatic relations,” marking the second time in a month an Arab Gulf nation has announced new ties with the Jewish state and further reshaping alliances in the Middle East.

title: United Arab Emirates and Israel to sign normalization agreement at White House next week
author: cnn
content: The White House will host a signing ceremony between the United Arab Emirates and Israel to document a new normalization deal between the two Middle Eastern countries that was brokered by the US, several administration officials said on Tuesday.

title: Two self-proclaimed members of ‘Boogaloo Bois’ charged with attempting to support Hamas
author: cnn
content: Two self-proclaimed members of the “Boogaloo Bois” were arrested by federal agents after allegedly conspiring and attempting to become “assets” to a foreign terrorist organization that shared their “anti-US government views,” the Justice Department announced on Friday.

title: With Macron’s visit to Beirut, Lebanon’s future is looking a lot like the past
author: cnn
content: On Lebanon’s centenary Tuesday, French jets whizzed over the mountains of its former mandate as a French president planted a cedar tree declaring the country’s “rebirth.”

title: First Israeli commercial flight between Israel and UAE takes to the skies
author: cnn
content: The first commercial flight from Israel to the United Arab Emirates (UAE) took to the skies on Monday, after an agreement to normalize relations between the two countries following a peace deal.

title: Lebanese diplomat Mustapha Adib named Prime Minister-designate ahead of Macron visit
author: cnn
content: Lebanon’s leaders have named the country’s ambassador to Germany, Mustapha Adib, as the Prime Minister-designate.

title: Israeli officials plan symbolic Middle East trip with high-level escort: the White House
author: cnn
content: A number of top Trump administration officials, including Jared Kushner, will escort Israeli government officials to the United Arab Emirates on the first-ever commercial flight between the two countries, expanding on a commitment by the White House to broker normalized relations between the two Middle Eastern countries.

title: The pain of loving Lebanon
author: cnn
content: Beirut’s blast was just the latest tragedy for a place of culture, beauty, and conflict, writes CNN’s Clarissa Ward.

title: The UAE-Israel announcement proves the folly of warming to Iran
author: cnn
content: The impending peace agreement between the United Arab Emirates and Israel is a game-changer for the entire Middle East, writes former Israeli Ambassador Michael Oren.

title: How to help Beirut explosion victims
author: cnn
content: An explosion rocked Lebanon’s capital city of Beirut, here’s how you can help the city and it’s people recover.

title: Opinion: UAE helps normalize Israeli oppression
author: cnn
content: Some are hailing the normalization of ties, but the deal breaks Arab consensus on Palestinian statehood and gives Israel a green light to continue its military rule of Palestinians who don’t have a vote, Yousef Munayyer writes.

title: Lebanese President says it’s ‘impossible’ for him to resign following Beirut’s deadly blast
author: cnn
content: Lebanese President Michel Aoun has said it would be “impossible” for him to resign following calls for him to leave office over the deadly explosion in Beirut.

title: Israel-UAE agreement a meek version of the historic Mideast deal Trump pledged
author: cnn
content: This is not THE Middle East peace deal that has beguiled a generation of American presidents, the one President Donald Trump commissioned his son-in-law and special advisor Jared Kushner to conclude.

title: Opinion: In Trumpian times, Israel and a Gulf State find common ground
author: cnn
content: The UAE–Israel announcement reflects a “rare coincidence of interests,” Aaron David Miller writes

title: Israel and the UAE establish ‘full normalization of relations’
author: cnn
content: Israel says it will ​temporarily “suspend​” plans to annex the West Bank, as part of a new peace deal with the United Arab Emirates.

title: Read the full statement by the US, Israel and UAE on normalizing Israel-UAE relations
author: cnn
content: Israel and the United Arab Emirates have agreed to normalize relations, US President Donald Trump announced Thursday.

title: Emirates and Siemens promise to help Lebanon with an airlift and free power
author: cnn
content: Emirates and Siemens have pledged to help the people of Lebanon recover from the cataclysmic explosion that rocked Beirut last week and pushed the country’s crisis-ridden economy towards the abyss.

title: Beirut’s once-thriving cultural community was already at breaking point. Then the blast hit
author: cnn
content: Already strained by a popular uprising, economic collapse and the global pandemic, Lebanon’s cultural sector was blown apart by the devastating explosion last week. Can it be rebuilt?

title: Lebanon’s government steps down in wake of Beirut blast
author: cnn
content: Lebanon’s government stepped down on Monday night, less than a week after a massive explosion in Beirut killed more than 170 people and wounded more than 6000, sparking days of violent protests.

title: Beirut blast survivor: The world can’t let this chaos go on
author: cnn
content: A catastrophe of the magnitude of the Beirut explosion should not pass without a major political transformation in the country. This is not only for the people of Lebanon, but for the belief that the word “justice” can still have a meaning on our planet, writes Rima Majed

title: As the people of Beirut clean up, France’s Macron urges world leaders to come together for Lebanon
author: cnn
content: French President Emmanuel Macron urged everyone “to come together in support of Lebanon and its people,” as he opened an international donors’ conference Sunday, five days after the devastating explosion that ripped through Beirut.

title: Lebanon has always deserved better from its leaders. The port blast lays that bare
author: cnn
content: The monstrous explosion that tore into the early evening of a mid-summer’s night this past Tuesday in Beirut is, whatever way you cut it, just the latest manifestation of the multitude of endless avenues of miserable corruption that have plagued the country for generations.

title: Lebanon protesters storm ministries as violent protests grip Beirut
author: cnn
content: Lebanon’s protesters stormed several government ministries as violent protests gripped Beirut on Saturday night.

title: A city ‘ruined in 30 seconds’: Lebanese basketball great Fadi El Khatib weeps for Beirut
author: cnn

title: They were laid off and far from home. Now an explosion in Beirut has left them even more vulnerable
author: cnn
content: Many domestic workers in Beirut were laid off from therr job in recent months because of the country’s deep economic crisis. Now in the aftermath of the explosions, many say they are stranded and unable to return home.

title: Search continues after deadly Beirut blast
author: cnn
content: At least 137 people were killed and 5,000 wounded in a massive explosion that shook Beirut on Tuesday, Follow here for the latest.

title: Lebanon’s economy was already in crisis. Then the blast hit Beirut
author: cnn
content: A cataclysmic blast in Beirut, Lebanon’s capital, is poised to send an economy already deep in crisis hurtling toward a dangerous unknown.

title: What we know about the Beirut blast
author: cnn
content: A massive explosion in the Lebanese capital of Beirut on Tuesday left 100 dead and thousands injured. Here’s what we know so far.

title: Don’t blame fate for Beirut’s cruel tragedy
author: cnn
content: Sometimes, it seems as if fate is trying to prove its unlimited capacity for cruelty. When the skies over Beirut exploded on Tuesday, sending shockwaves felt all the way to Cyprus, 150 miles away in the Mediterranean, and devastating much of a city that was once known as the Paris of the Middle East, it seemed one of those times.

title: Beirut will never be the same again
author: cnn
content: In a city that was long a hodgepodge of political, religious and economic differences, the damage spared no one, Tamara Qiblawi writes.

title: Tel Aviv lights up its city hall with the Lebanese flag in a sign of solidarity
author: cnn
content: Israel considers Lebanon an enemy state, but today, Tel Aviv stood in solidarity with its northern neighbor.

title: Lebanon explosion: Thousands injured across capital Beirut
author: cnn
content: A massive explosion ripped through central Beirut on Tuesday, killing dozens of people, injuring thousands and blowing out windows in buildings across the city.

title: ‘We have nothing left’
author: cnn
content: Buildings miles away from the blast were damaged. Shards of glass filled the thoroughfares, and street lights were extinguished by its force. The people of Beirut, a city already teetering on the brink of collapse, rushed to hospitals to donate blood.

title: Israel says it exchanged fire with Hezbollah in thwarted attack near Lebanese border
author: cnn
content: Israeli forces said they exchanged fire with Hezbollah along the Israel-Lebanon border on Monday after the Iran-backed group staged an attack in a disputed region.

title: Restaurateurs serve Netanyahu a ‘final meal’ as chaos mounts over Israel’s coronavirus restrictions
author: cnn
content: The pressure on Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu is building as quickly as the protests, with his official residence on Balfour Street now the focal point of protests that are growing in frequency and in size.

title: Dumpster diving, blackouts and suicides. Lebanon’s woes laid bare as crisis deepens
author: cnn
content: As Lebanon entered a Covid-induced lockdown earlier this year, the destruction of the middle class remained largely out of sight, but now there’s no escaping the dystopian scenes of desperation.

title: Israel had coronavirus firmly in its grasp, only to see it slip away
author: cnn
content: Israel’s first wave of coronavirus was a success story, but its health officials say a second wave appears to be on track for a very different ending.

title: Why West Bank annexation poses an existential threat to Jordan
author: cnn
content: While the immediate timetable for West Bank annexation might be slipping a bit, Israel still appears to be on the verge of unilaterally proclaiming sovereignty on a patch of land that is a critical part of Jordan’s foreign and domestic policy. This has driven the Jordanian sovereign, King Abdullah, into a corner.

title: Video of Palestinian man being shot after suspected attack at checkpoint sparks controversy
author: cnn
content: The death of 28-year-old Ahmad Erekat at a checkpoint east of Jerusalem on Tuesday has thrown into sharp relief once again the bitter divisions and lack of trust between Israelis and Palestinians. Police video of the incident released a day later appears only to have underlined the sharp differences.

title: Nationwide protests grip Lebanon as currency tanks
author: cnn
content: Lebanese protesters took to the streets in multiple cities on Thursday night amid a rapid slide in the country’s currency.

title: Israel has a lot to lose by annexing West Bank territory
author: cnn
content: Robert Satloff writes that Israel’s plans to annex West Bank territory threatens to trigger a severe worsening of tensions with Palestinians, a suspension of its peace treaty with Jordan, and an end to the Jewish state’s incremental normalization with Arab states, especially in the Gulf. Annexation will also distract the world from the urgent threat of a nuclearizing Iran, which is working to expand its influence near Israel’s borders.

title: Gantz tells Israeli Army to step up preparations in West Bank ahead of possible annexation
author: cnn
content: Israel’s Defense Minister Benny Gantz has told the army to step up preparations in parts of the West Bank, heightening the sense the government stands ready to make a possible dramatic announcement on annexation in the next few weeks.

title: Unarmed Palestinian man shot dead by police in Jerusalem
author: cnn
content: An unarmed Palestinian man has been shot and killed by police at one of the entrances to Jerusalem’s Old City on Saturday. Israeli police said officers believed the man had a gun and opened fire on him when he refused to stop for them.

title: Why some ultra-Orthodox Jewish communities defy social distancing
author: cnn
content: Mass arrests in Israel earlier this week are the latest incident in a global trend with dangerous consequences – a small but committed segment of the ultra-Orthodox Jewish community refusing to obey social distancing orders.

title: Pompeo travels to Israel amid coronavirus outbreak
author: cnn
content: Secretary of State Mike Pompeo departed for Israel on Tuesday as Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu eyes annexation of parts of the West Bank and the coronavirus pandemic continues to sweep the globe.

title: ‘If your child is hungry, you will eat your rulers to feed your children’
author: cnn
content: Nightly confrontations between protesters and the army have rocked Lebanon’s northern city of Tripoli after the coronavirus pushed an already dangerous economic situation over the edge.

title: Violent protests erupt in Lebanon as pandemic makes financial crisis worse
author: cnn
content: Lebanon is in turmoil.

title: Germany bans Lebanese militant group Hezbollah and raids mosques and homes
author: cnn
content: Germany announced Thursday it has designated the Lebanese militant and political group Hezbollah a terror organization, banning all of its activities in the country and ordering raids on sites police say are linked to the group.

title: 75% of Lebanon needs aid after coronavirus, and hungry protesters are back on the streets
author: cnn
content: Cash-strapped Lebanon is facing growing turmoil after the fallout from the coronavirus outbreak sparked violent protests over rising hunger and poverty.

title: Benjamin Netanyahu and Benny Gantz agree on national emergency government in Israel
author: cnn
content: Israel’s Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu and Blue and White party leader Benny Gantz have agreed on the formation of a national emergency government, according to a joint statement from Blue and White and Netanyahu’s Likud party.

title: Thousands of Israelis protest against Netanyahu, two meters apart
author: cnn
content: Spaced out evenly across an open space in the heart of Tel Aviv, Israelis protested on Sunday against Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu’s policies.

title: US citizens in Lebanon decline repatriation offer, saying it’s ‘safer’ in Beirut
author: cnn
content: Many US citizens in Lebanon have declined a recent embassy offer for repatriation, citing skyrocketing cases in the US. “It’s safer in Beirut,” some said.

title: Some ultra-Orthodox Jews are ignoring Israel’s coronavirus rules, despite a warning to ‘wake up!’
author: cnn
content: Israel has tightened coronavirus restrictions to slow the outbreak. Though police say most people are heeding the instructions, the seriousness of the situation seems yet to have fully penetrated the ultra-Orthodox community.

title: The Joint List is the real opposition to Israel’s right-wing governments
author: cnn
content: The parliamentary head of the predominantly Arab bloc, Dr. Ahmad Tibi, writes that as Israel adopts discriminatory policies under Prime Minister Netanyahu, the Joint List isn’t just for Arabs–it’s for anyone who opposes the trend

title: Muslim and Jewish paramedics pause to pray together. One of many inspiring moments in the coronavirus crisis
author: cnn
content: Two paramedics in Israel, a Muslim and Jew, take a break to pray together. One prayed in the direction of Mecca, the other toward Jerusalem. A photograph of the moment garnered attention from around the world.

title: Warnings over harm to Israel’s ‘democratic system’ amid coronavirus crisis
author: cnn
content: Israel’s President has warned of possible harm to the country’s democracy, after the Speaker of Parliament refused to hold key parliamentary votes.

title: Israel is deploying spy technology to track the virus, prompting fears of privacy invasion
author: cnn
content: In the ongoing fight against the coronavirus, Israel has approved the electronic tracking of patients, using a digital technology that, until now, was used only for counterterrorism.

title: Amid coronavirus fears, Israel’s Benjamin Netanyahu sees an opening
author: cnn
content: As the spread of coronavirus affects virtually every aspect of life in Israel, Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu has become a staple of prime-time television. Most evenings, he can be found on the 8pm news broadcasts issuing new instructions and trying to reassure the country of 8.7 million people that everything will be fine.

title: Ex-Trump envoy: For Palestinians and Israelis, this is the deal that can be done now
author: cnn
content: President Donald Trump’s former special envoy for the Middle East, Jason Greenblatt, says the administration’s peace plan is not perfect from the Palestinian or Israeli standpoint, but is the most feasible and forward-looking possible after years of failed negotiations.

title: Israeli election exit polls project Netanyahu in lead
author: cnn
content: Polls by Israel’s three main news channels project Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu’s Likud party to win more seats than its main challenger, the Blue & White party.

title: Trump’s Middle East plan could jeopardize Jordan-Israel peace treaty, Jordan PM says
author: cnn
content: In 1994, King Hussein of Jordan and Israeli Prime Minister Yitzhak Rabin signed a declaration that both men hoped would lay the foundation for peace between their countries, and the wider region. Twenty-five years on, Jordan’s Prime Minister now says the two countries’ relationship is at the “lowest level” since the signing.

title: Israel’s Netanyahu on course to win most seats, but may be short of majority
author: cnn
content: Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu looks set to come out top in Israel’s general election, but his hopes of a straightforward path towards forming a governing majority in parliament look set to be dashed.

title: Netanyahu projected to win Israeli election, but exit polls suggest bloc just short of majority
author: cnn
content: As counting gets underway in Israel’s unprecedented third election in 11 months, initial exit polls projected Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu’s Likud party as the winners.

title: Israel is voting on Monday. Here’s what you need to know
author: cnn
content: Israel is holding its third election in 11 months, with voters trying to find a way to break the country’s seemingly intractable political deadlock.

title: Netanyahu is fighting for power like his freedom depends on it – and it might
author: cnn
content: Nearly everything about the last year in Israeli politics has been unprecedented. A second election. A third election. A sitting Prime Minister indicted. That same Prime Minister standing next to the US President and talking about imminent annexation of Palestinian territory.

title: Israel and Palestinian militants exchange fire as graphic video of Israeli bulldozer carrying a body goes viral
author: cnn
content: The Israeli military and Palestinian militants in Gaza exchanged fire on Sunday, hours after a graphic video showing an Israeli army bulldozer scraping the body of a dead man off the ground went viral.

title: As election looms, Netanyahu announces new construction in East Jerusalem
author: cnn
content: With eleven days to go until Israel’s election, Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu has announced plans to build thousands of new homes in a part of Jerusalem that the international community holds as the capital of a future Palestinian state.

title: Benjamin Netanyahu’s corruption trial will start two weeks after Israel’s elections
author: cnn
content: Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu’s criminal trial is set to begin March 17, just two weeks after Israel’s elections, the Justice Ministry announced Tuesday.

title: Syrians are in a desperate race to outrun a brutal regime offensive
author: cnn
content: It’s freezing cold and the kids don’t have proper shoes, but the elderly Samar couldn’t risk it. Overnight, the bombings got too close.

title: UN publishes ‘blacklist’ of companies doing business in Israeli settlements
author: cnn
content: The United Nations has published a database of more than one hundred companies it says are doing business in Israeli settlements in the occupied Palestinian territories. Though welcomed by Palestinian leadership, the list prompted a furious response from Israeli leaders who denounced it as an anti-Israel ‘blacklist.’

title: Three Palestinians killed, 12 Israeli soldiers hurt in 24 hours of violence
author: cnn
content: Twelve Israeli soldiers were injured in a ramming attack in Jerusalem early Thursday morning carried out by a Palestinian assailant, according to a spokesman for the Israel Defense Forces (IDF), as tensions rise across the region.

title: Palestinians say Trump’s deal is racist. But their leaders are bereft of ideas on how to fight it
author: cnn
content: Palestinians have pronounced Trump’s Mideast plan “dead on arrival” and are refusing to even entertain it. But their leadership appears to be struggling with what to do next.

title: Kushner defends conditions for Palestinians to get a state and ‘take control of themselves’
author: cnn
content: President Donald Trump’s senior adviser Jared Kushner told CNN that if Palestinians can’t meet certain conditions under the administration’s Middle East plan, then he doesn’t believe Israel should take “the risk to recognize them as a state.”

title: What Trump’s Middle East plan means for Palestinians
author: cnn
content: Mustafa Barghouti writes that the Trump’s proposed Israel-Palestine deal violates international law, ends any possibility for an independent, sovereign Palestine and would enforce apartheid-like conditions on Palestinians.

title: Jared Kushner: A pivotal moment in the Middle East
author: cnn
content: President Donald Trump’s senior adviser describes the administration’s peace plan and says it will offer key benefits to both Israelis and Palestinians.

title: Trump’s plan gives Israel a green light to annex part of the West Bank. Here’s what that looks like
author: cnn
content: Israel’s Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu was in no doubt. January 28, 2020, would be as historic an occasion as May 14, 1948, the day Israel declared independence and was recognized as a state by then-US President Harry Truman.

title: Pro-Israel Democratic super PAC takes aim at Bernie Sanders in Iowa
author: cnn
content: A pro-Israel Democratic super PAC is launching a new television ad on Wednesday in Iowa that questions Sen. Bernie Sanders’ electability and raises the specter of his health following a heart attack last fall.

title: Hamas surprise attack out of Gaza stuns Israel and leaves hundreds dead in fighting, retaliation
author: JOSEF FEDERMAN Associated Press and ISSAM ADWAN Associated Press
content: Hamas militants have fired thousands of rockets and sent dozens of fighters into Israeli towns near the Gaza Strip in an unprecedented surprise early morning attack during a major Jewish holiday

title: Israel says Palestinian militants have infiltrated into Israeli territory from Gaza
author: The Associated Press
content: Israel says Palestinian militants have infiltrated into Israeli territory from Gaza

title: Israel's Netanyahu says offensive against Hamas will 'reverberate' for generations
author: The Associated Press
content: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu says Israel’s fierce offensive against Hamas in the Gaza Strip has “only started.”

title: Palestinian Health Ministry says at least 198 killed, 1,610 wounded in Gaza in Israeli retaliation after Hamas attack
author: The Associated Press
content: Palestinian Health Ministry says at least 198 killed, 1,610 wounded in Gaza in Israeli retaliation after Hamas attack

title: Gunfire, rockets and carnage: Israelis are stunned and shaken by unprecedented Hamas attack
author: ISABEL DEBRE Associated Press
content: Israelis huddled in bomb shelters pleading for help as Hamas fighters broke into their houses and shot at anyone they saw

title: Hamas attack on Israel thrusts Biden into Mideast crisis and has him fending off GOP criticism
author: MATTHEW LEE Associated Press and AAMER MADHANI Associated Press
content: President Joe Biden has been thrust into a Middle East crisis that risks expanding into a broader conflict and has left him fending off criticism from GOP presidential rivals that his administration’s policies led to this moment

title: Israel declares war, bombards Gaza and battles to dislodge Hamas fighters after surprise attack
author: TIA GOLDENBERG Associated Press and WAFAA SHURAFA Associated Press
content: The Israeli government has formally declared war and given the green light for “significant military steps” to retaliate against Hamas for its surprise attack from the Gaza Strip

title: Hezbollah bombards Israeli positions in disputed area along border with Syria's Golan Heights
author: The Associated Press
content: Lebanon’s Hezbollah militant group has fired dozens of rockets and shells at three Israeli positions in a disputed area along the country’s border with Syria’s Israeli-occupied Golan Heights

title: A policeman in Egypt killed 2 Israelis and 1 Egyptian at a tourist site in Alexandria
author: The Associated Press
content: Egyptian authorities say a policeman opened fire on Israeli tourists in the Mediterranean city of Alexandria, killing at least two Israelis and one Egyptian

title: Israeli and Palestinian supporters rally across U.S. as Israel declares war after Hamas attack
author: BOBCAINA CALVAN Associated Press and JAKE BLEIBERG Associated Press
content: Supporters of Israel and backers of the Palestinian cause rallied in American cities Sunday over the conflict that has killed hundreds and wounded thousands in the Middle East

title: Israeli hostage crisis in Hamas-ruled Gaza becomes a political trap for Netanyahu
author: ISABEL DEBRE Associated Press
content: The capture of dozens of Israeli soldiers and civilians by Hamas militants has stirred Israeli emotions more viscerally than any crisis in the country’s recent memory

title: An Israeli airstrike kills 19 members of the same family in a southern Gaza refugee camp
author: ISSAM ADWAN Associated Press
content: Nasser Abu Quta lost 19 members of his family in an instant when an Israeli airstrike blew up his home in a crowded refugee camp in the southern Gaza Strip

title: 5 things to know as Israel declares war on Hamas following the militant group's unprecedented attack
author: ISABEL DEBRE Associated Press
content: Israel has declared war, bombarding the Gaza strip with airstrikes in retaliation for a major surprise attack by the militant group Hamas

title: US demands condemnation of Hamas at UN meeting, but Security Council takes no immediate action
author: EDITH M. LEDERER Associated Press
content: The U_N_ Security Council has held an emergency meeting behind closed doors with the United States demanding that all 15 members strongly condemn “these heinous terrorist attacks committed by Hamas.”

title: Israeli survivors recount terror at music festival, where Hamas militants killed at least 260
author: ISABEL DEBRE Associated Press and MICHAEL BIESECKER Associated Press
content: The open-air Tribe of Nova music festival will go down in Israeli history as the country’s worst civilian massacre

title: What went wrong? Questions emerge over Israel's intelligence prowess after Hamas attack
author: TIA GOLDENBERG Associated Press
content: Israel’s intelligence agencies have gained an aura of invincibility over the decades because of a string of intelligence achievements against its enemies both near and far

title: Israel strikes and seals off Gaza after incursion by Hamas, which vows to execute hostages
author: JOSEF FEDERMAN Associated Press and ISSAM ADWAN Associated Press
content: Israel increased airstrikes on the Gaza Strip and sealed it off from food, fuel, and other supplies in retaliation for a bloody incursion by Hamas militants, as the war’s death toll rose to nearly 1,600 on both sides

title: Stock market today: Markets steady in Asia after Israel declares war following Hamas attack in Gaza
author: ELAINE KURTENBACH AP business writer
content: Share prices have opened little changed after the the Israeli government declared war following deadly attacks by Hamas from the Gaza Strip

title: US Senate Majority Leader Schumer meets Xi and welcomes stronger Chinese statement on Hamas attack
author: KEN MORITSUGU Associated Press
content: U.S. Senate Majority Leader Chuck Schumer says he is grateful for a stronger statement from China condemning the deadly Hamas attack on Israel issued during his visit to Beijing that included a lengthy meeting with President Xi Jinping

title: Major airlines suspend flights to Israel after massive attack by Hamas
author: MICHELLE CHAPMAN Associated Press
content: Major airlines are suspending flights to Israel after it formally declared war following a massive attack by Hamas

title: UN airs concerns for civilians as Israel steps up military response in Gaza to deadly Hamas attacks
author: JAMEY KEATEN Associated Press
content: The United Nations is expressing growing concerns about humanitarian needs in Palestinian areas as Israel ratchets up a muscular military riposte and lockdown of Gaza after the weekend attack by Hamas militants who killed and kidnapped hundreds of civi...

title: Hamas official says Iran and Hezbollah had no role in Israel incursion but they'll help if needed
author: BASSEM MROUE Associated Press and SARAH EL DEEB Associated Press
content: A senior official with the Palestinian militant group Hamas says only a small number of top commanders in Gaza knew about the surprise attack against Israel in advance

title: What is Hamas? The group that rules the Gaza Strip has fought several rounds of war with Israel
author: SARAH EL DEEB Associated Press
content: Hamas has ruled the Gaza Strip since 2007

title: Aid groups scramble to help as Israel-Hamas war intensifies and Gaza blockade complicates efforts
author: HALELUYA HADERO AP business writer
content: Humanitarian groups are scrambling to assist civilians caught in the war between Israel and Hamas and determine what aid operations are still safe to continue, efforts that are being complicated by an intensified blockade of Gaza and the ongoing fighting

title: Biden's hopes for establishing Israel-Saudi relations could become a casualty of the new Mideast war
author: AAMER MADHANI Associated Press and ELLEN KNICKMEYER Associated Press
content: The outbreak of war between Israel and the Palestinians is threatening to delay or derail a country-by-country diplomatic push by the United States to improve relations between Israel and its Arab neighbors

title: As Israel pummels Gaza, families of those held hostage by militants agonize over loved ones' safety
author: JULIA FRANKEL Associated Press and ADAM GELLER Associated Press
content: The families of some 130 Israelis kidnapped by Hamas are anxiously waiting to find out if their loved ones are safe

title: Day 4 of the latest Israel-Palestinian war
author: The Associated Press
content: Israel has stepped up its offensive on the Gaza Strip in response to an unprecedented attack by Hamas

title: Palestinians scramble for safety as Israel pounds sealed-off Gaza Strip to punish Hamas
author: JOSEF FEDERMAN Associated Press and ISSAM ADWAN Associated Press
content: Israeli warplanes hammered the Gaza Strip neighborhood by neighborhood on Tuesday, reducing buildings to rubble and sending people scrambling to find safety in the tiny, sealed-off territory now suffering severe retaliation for the deadly weekend attac...

title: Under heavy bombing, Palestinians in Gaza move from place to place, only to discover nowhere is safe
author: ISSAM ADWAN Associated Press
content: Tens of thousands of Palestinians in the Gaza Strip are packed into U.N. shelters as Israeli warplanes pound the tiny territory of 2.3 million people after their Hamas militant rulers launched an unprecedented attack on Israel

title: Unprecedented Israeli bombardment lays waste to upscale Rimal, the beating heart of Gaza City
author: ISSAM ADWAN Associated Press
content: Following a night of intense bombardment, residents were struggling Tuesday to grasp the sheer scale of damage inflicted on the upscale Rimal neighborhood in central Gaza City

title: Biden confirms Americans among hostages captured in Israel, condemns 'sheer evil' of Hamas militants
author: AAMER MADHANI Associated Press, TARA COPP Associated Press, and DARLENE SUPERVILLE Associated Press
content: President Joe Biden is confirming that U.S. citizens are among the hostages captured by Hamas in this weekend’s attack on Israel

title: Hamas' unprecedented attack on Israel raises questions about the influence of its sponsor, Iran
author: JON GAMBRELL Associated Press
content: Hamas’ unprecedented attack on Israel and the war it launched has raised new questions about the influence of its main sponsor, Iran, and whether it had anything to do with the assault

title: FACT FOCUS: Misinformation about the Israel-Hamas war is flooding social media. Here are the facts
author: The Associated Press
content: False claims about the latest Israel-Hamas war are flooding social media, making it difficult for onlookers to sort fact from fiction

title: Israeli village near the Gaza border lies in ruin, filled with the bodies of residents and militants
author: SAM MCNEIL Associated Press
content: An Israeli village that was attacked by militants lies in ruin, not far from the border with Gaza

title: Israelis abroad desperately try to head home to join military units, or just to help
author: JOCELYN NOVECK Associated Press, MENELAOS HADJICOSTIS Associated Press, and AMY TAXIN Associated Press
content: Some Israelis living overseas aren’t running from the war at home, but to it.

title: As strikes devastate Gaza, Israel forms unity government to oversee war sparked by Hamas attack
author: JOSEPH KRAUSS Associated Press and WAFAA SHURAFA Associated Press
content: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu joined Wednesday with a top political rival to create a wartime Cabinet overseeing the fight to avenge a gruesome weekend attack by Hamas militants

title: Day 5 of the latest Israel-Palestinian war
author: The Associated Press
content: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu has vowed to “crush and destroy” Hamas after its unprecedented attack on Israel

title: Gaza is tiny and watched closely by Israel. But rescuing hostages there would be a daunting task
author: AMY TEIBEL Associated Press
content: The Hamas-run Gaza Strip is a tiny enclave, measuring 25 miles long and no more than 7 miles wide

title: What was Hamas thinking? For over three decades, it has had the same brutal idea of victory
author: JOSEPH KRAUSS Associated Press
content: In the three and a half decades since it began as an underground militant group, Hamas has pursued a consistently violent strategy aimed at rolling back Israeli rule

title: Families in Israel and abroad wait in agony for word of their loved ones taken hostage by militants
author: DANICA KIRKA Associated Press and AMI BENTOV Associated Press
content: One of those taken hostage is a grandmother who learned Arabic in hopes of building bridges with her neighbors

title: After a hard fight to clear militants, Israeli soldiers find a scene of destruction, slain children
author: SAM MCNEIL Associated Press
content: The Israeli military led a group of journalists, including an Associated Press reporter, on a tour of Kibbutz Be'eri, a village a few miles from Israel’s fortified border with Gaza

title: Day 6 of the latest Israel-Palestinian war
author: The Associated Press
content: The Israeli government is under intense public pressure Thursday to topple Hamas as the latest Gaza war reaches its sixth day

title: Israel orders the evacuation of 1.1 million people from northern part of Gaza, the UN says
author: JOSEPH KRAUSS Associated Press and WAFAA SHURAFA Associated Press
content: Israel’s military has directed the evacuation of northern Gaza, a region that is home to 1.1 million people, within 24 hours

title: Germany offers Israel military help and promises to crack down at home on support for Hamas
author: The Associated Press
content: Germany is offering military help to Israel and promising to crack down on support for the militant Hamas group at home following its attack on Israel

title: Trump's criticism of Israel's Netanyahu draws strong condemnation from GOP rivals
author: JILL COLVIN Associated Press and ADRIANA GOMEZ LICON Associated Press
content: Several of former President Donald Trump’s Republican rivals are denouncing him for lashing out at Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu days after Hamas’ deadly attack

title: Syria says Israeli airstrikes hit airports in Damascus and Aleppo, damaging their runways
author: ALBERT AJI Associated Press
content: Syrian state media says Israeli airstrikes have hit the international airports of the Syrian capital Damascus and the northern city of Aleppo amid regional tensions, damaging their runways and putting them out of service

title: English Football Association to honor the Israeli and Palestinian victims at Wembley Stadium
author: The Associated Press
content: The English Football Association says it will pay tribute to the Israeli and Palestinian victims of the war in the Middle East when England hosts Australia in a friendly match at Wembley Stadium

title: A 'Zionist in my heart': Biden's devotion to Israel faces a new test
author: CHRIS MEGERIAN Associated Press
content: President Joe Biden has spent decades as a stalwart supporter of Israel, a connection rooted in long-ago dinner table conversations with his father about the Holocaust

title: The morgue at Gaza's biggest hospital is overflowing as Israeli attacks intensify
author: ISABEL DEBRE Associated Press, SAMYA KULLAB Associated Press, and MOHAMMED JAHJOUH Associated Press
content: The morgue at Gaza’s biggest hospital, Shifa in Gaza City, is overflowing on the sixth day of heavy aerial bombardment on the territory of 2.3 million people

title: France has banned pro-Palestinian protests and vowed to protect Jews from resurgent antisemitism
author: ANGELA CHARLTON Associated Press and JEFFREY SCHAEFFER Associated Press
content: France’s interior minister ordered local authorities to ban all pro-Palestinian demonstrations amid a rise in antisemitic acts since Hamas attacked Israel over the weekend

title: In its quest to crush Hamas, Israel will confront the bitter, familiar dilemmas of Mideast wars
author: JOSEPH KRAUSS Associated Press
content: As Israel escalates its war on Hamas, it will confront many of the same dilemmas it has grappled with over decades of conflict with the Palestinians

title: As Israel battles Hamas, all eyes are on Hezbollah, the wild card on its northern border
author: KAREEM CHEHAYEB Associated Press and ABSEWELL Associated Press
content: Will Lebanon’s heavily armed Hezbollah militia join the Israel-Hamas war

title: Hamas practiced in plain sight, posting video of mock attack weeks before border breach
author: MICHAEL BIESECKER Associated Press and SARAH EL DEEB Associated Press
content: Less than a month before Hamas fighters blew through Israel's “Iron Wall” in an attack that would leave more than 1,200 Israelis dead, they practiced in a very public dress rehearsal

title: Day 7 of the latest Israel-Hamas war
author: The Associated Press
content: Israel’s military has ordered hundreds of thousands of civilians living in Gaza City to evacuate ahead of a feared Israel ground offensive

title: A music festival survivor fleeing the attack, a pair of Hamas militants and a deadly decision
author: ALON BERNSTEIN Associated Press and SAM MCNEIL Associated Press
content: When Hamas militants swarmed into Israel over the weekend, one of their first targets was the Tribe of Nova music festival

title: Blinken and Austin bolster US support for Israel as potential ground offensive in Gaza looms
author: LOLITA C. BALDOR Associated Press and MATTHEW LEE Associated Press
content: Defense Secretary Lloyd Austin is assuring Israel that “we have your back” as he and America’s top diplomat met with Israeli and Arab leaders

title: An employee at the Israeli Embassy in China has been stabbed. A foreign suspect is detained
author: KEN MORITSUGU Associated Press and JON GAMBRELL Associated Press
content: A 50-year-old Israeli man who works at the Israeli Embassy in Beijing has been stabbed in front of a supermarket

title: Tens of thousands protest after Muslim prayers across Mideast over Israeli airstrikes on Gaza
author: ISABEL DEBRE Associated Press and JON GAMBRELL Associated Press
content: Tens of thousands of Muslims are demonstrating across the Middle East in support of the Palestinians and to protest against the Israeli airstrikes pounding the Gaza Strip

title: Israeli shelling along Lebanon border kills 1 journalist, wounds 6
author: HASSAN AMMAR Associated Press
content: An Israeli shell has landed in a gathering of international journalists covering clashes on the border in south Lebanon, killing a Reuters videographer and leaving six other journalists injured

title: In Israel's call for mass evacuation, Palestinians hear echoes of their original catastrophic exodus
author: JOSEPH KRAUSS Associated Press
content: In Israel’s call for the evacuation of half of Gaza many Palestinians fear a repeat of their mass exodus from what is now Israel

title: Palestinians in Gaza face impossible choice: Stay home under airstrikes, or flee under airstrikes?
author: ISABEL DEBRE Associated Press and FATIMA SHBAIR Associated Press
content: Palestinians are struggling to figure out what to do in the face of Israel's demand that they leave northern Gaza ahead of an expected Israeli invasion

title: Gaza's desperate civilians flee or huddle in hopes of safety, as warnings of Israeli offensive mount
author: WAFAA SHURAFA Associated Press and JOSEPH KRAUSS Associated Press
content: Palestinians are struggling to flee from areas of Gaza targeted by the Israeli military ahead of an expected land offensive a week after Hamas’ bloody attack into Israel

title: Day 8 of the latest Israel-Hamas war
author: The Associated Press
content: Israel’s military ordered hundreds of thousands of civilians living in Gaza City to evacuate ahead of an expected Israeli ground offensive

title: Iran's foreign minister warns Israel from Beirut it could suffer 'a huge earthquake'
author: BASSEM MROUE Associated Press

title: In first call with Palestinian president Abbas, Biden discusses support for humanitarian aid to Gaza

title: California authorities seek video, urge patience in investigation into death of Jewish demonstrator
author: The Associated Press
content: Days after asking for the public’s help to determine what happened at a California protest that resulted in a Jewish demonstrator’s death, authorities say they still have no video of the incident and are urging patience as they investigate

title: Palestinian soccer team prepares for World Cup qualifying games against a backdrop of war

content: Makram Daboub may be struggling to prepare his Palestinian team for the start of 2026 World Cup qualification but he takes some comfort — for now at least — that his players stuck in Gaza are safe

title: Dubai air chiefs summit, sponsored by Israeli firm, avoids discussing strikes as Hamas war rages
author: JON GAMBRELL Associated Press
content: As Israel unleashes one of the most-intense aerial bombing campaigns the Middle East has ever seen, leaders from the world’s top air forces are meeting in the United Arab Emirates to talk about almost anything that isn’t an airstrike

title: More than 180,000 people across France march against soaring antisemitism amid the Israel-Hamas war
author: SYLVIE CORBET Associated Press and BARBARA SURK Associated Press
content: More than 180,000 people across France, including 100,000 in Paris, have marched peacefully to protest against rising antisemitism in the wake of Israel’s ongoing war against Hamas in Gaza

title: Thousands march through Amsterdam calling for climate action
author: MIKE CORDER Associated Press
content: Climate activist Greta Thunberg has been briefly interrupted by a man who approached her on stage after she invited a Palestinian and an Afghan woman to speak at a climate protest in the Dutch capital

title: Attacks by Lebanon's Hezbollah group wound 7 Israeli troops, 10 others along border with Israel
author: AMY TEIBEL Associated Press
content: Israel’s military and rescue services say attacks by Lebanon’s Hezbollah group have wounded seven Israeli troops and 10 other people

title: Rep. Ilhan Omar draws prominent primary challenger
author: STEVE KARNOWSKI Associated Press

title: King Charles III leads national memorial service honoring those who served the UK

author: ROD MCGUIRK Associated Press
content: Australia's immigration minister says 80 people including convicted criminals who are considered dangerous have been released from Australian migrant detention centers since the High Court ruled last week that their indefinite detention wis unconstitut...

author: DAVID BAUDER AP media writer

author: CHRIS MEGERIAN Associated Press and JOSH BOAK Associated Press

title: Biden says Gaza hospital encircled by Israeli forces 'must be protected,' calls for less intrusive action against Hamas

title: Detroit-area doctor grieves the loss of 20 relatives killed during Israel's war against Hamas
author: The Associated Press

author: JOSEF FEDERMAN Associated Press

author: ERIC TUCKER Associated Press and ABSEWELL Associated Press
content: A video broadcast on an Iraqi television station and circulated on pro-Iranian social media purports to show an Israeli-Russian researcher who was allegedly kidnapped in Iraq

title: Long-haul carrier Emirates signals it will hold off on major Airbus purchase over engine worries
author: MALAK HARB Associated Press and JON GAMBRELL Associated Press

title: Renowned Canadian-born Israeli peace activist Vivian Silver is confirmed killed in Hamas attack
author: AMY TEIBEL Associated Press
content: Vivian Silver, a Canadian-born Israeli activist who devoted her life to seeking peace with the Palestinians, was confirmed killed in Hamas’ Oct. 7 incursion into southern Israel

title: Jewish protesters stage sit-in at California federal building, demand Gaza cease-fire
author: The Associated Press

author: JON GAMBRELL Associated Press
content: Satellite photos analyzed by The Associated Press show that Israeli tanks and armored vehicles pushed further into the Gaza Strip late last week as part of an offensive squeezing Gaza City as fighting raged between its forces and Hamas militants

author: JILL LAWLESS Associated Press

title: Tens of thousands of supporters of Israel rally in Washington, crying 'never again'
author: REBECCA SANTANA Associated Press and MICHAEL BALSAMO Associated Press
content: Supporters of Israel have rallied by the tens of thousands on Washington's National Mall, voicing solidarity in the fight against Hamas and crying “never again.”

title: U.N. agency for Palestinian refugees says its fuel storage facility in Gaza is empty, relief operations will soon end
author: The Associated Press
content: U.N. agency for Palestinian refugees says its fuel storage facility in Gaza is empty, relief operations will soon end

title: Israeli soccer team captain displays shoe of kidnapped child ahead of qualifying match in Hungary
author: JUSTIN SPIKE Associated Press
content: The captain of Israel’s soccer team displayed the shoe of a young boy that he said was kidnapped by Hamas militants during their deadly Oct. 7 raid, an act of solidarity with those Israelis still being held captive in the Gaza Strip ahead of the team’s...

title: Israeli military says it is carrying out "precise and targeted operation" inside Gaza's Shifa Hospital
author: The Associated Press
content: Israeli military says it is carrying out "precise and targeted operation" inside Gaza's Shifa Hospital

title: From Israel to India, America’s illiberal allies are hurting its moral standing
author: Mohamed Zeeshan
content: Having spent the past several months focusing his foreign policy on Ukraine, US President Joe Biden is watching  another war unfold, this time in Gaza.The new crisis in the Middle East is a stark reminder of the polarised world order and difficult moral choices that have defined Biden’s office. When he became president in 2021, he framed global politics as a  struggle between democracies and autocracies. The key thrust of that message was to find like-minded partners – deemed “democratic” by Washington – to counter America’s major geopolitical rivals, namely China and Russia.Biden also used this rhetoric on democratic values as a response to his predecessor, Donald Trump. As president, Trump had largely dispensed with values-based rhetoric in foreign policy, leading an era of “ America first” isolationism, and praising autocratic leaders from Hungary’s Viktor Orban to Russia’s Vladimir Putin.Biden called on the US to return to a role of moral leadership – to “ prove democracy works” – and strengthen democracy at home and abroad. This, he proposed, would distinguish the US from its rivals. To that end, Biden organised two Summits for Democracy and rallied countries around democratic norms and values.
